Chris Wallace: "Our first subject is the Supreme Court."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump, you nominated Amy Coney Barrett over the weekend to succeed the late Ruth Bader Ginsburg on the Court."\n
Chris Wallace: "You say the Constitution is clear about your obligation and the Senate’s to consider a nominee to the Court."\n
Chris Wallace: "Vice President Biden, you say that this is an effort by the President and Republicans to jam through on an appointment in what you call an abuse of power."\n
Chris Wallace: "My first question to both of you tonight, why are you right in the argument you make and your opponent wrong?"\n
Chris Wallace: "And where do you think a Justice Barrett would take the court?"\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump, in this first segment, you go first."\n
Chris Wallace: "Two minutes."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you very much, Chris."\n
Donald Trump: "I will tell you very simply."\n
Donald Trump: "We won the election."\n
Donald Trump: "Elections have consequences."\n
Donald Trump: "We have the Senate, we have the White House, and we have a phenomenal nominee respected by all."\n
Donald Trump: "Top, top academic, good in every way."\n
Donald Trump: "Good in every way."\n

Donald Trump: "He’s been a professor for a long time at a great school."\n
Donald Trump: "And we won the election and therefore we have the right to choose her, and very few people knowingly would say otherwise."\n
Donald Trump: "And by the way, the Democrats, they wouldn’t even think about not doing it."\n
Donald Trump: "The only difference is they’d try and do it faster."\n
Donald Trump: "There’s no way they would give it up."\n

Chris Wallace: "Same question to you, Vice President Biden."\n

Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, thank you for doing this and looking forward to this, Mr. President."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you, Joe."\n
Joe Biden: "The American people have a right to have a say in who the Supreme Court nominee is and that say occurs when they vote for United States Senators and when they vote for the President of United States."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re not going to get that chance now because we’re in the middle of an election already."\n
Joe Biden: "The election has already started."\n
Joe Biden: "Tens of thousands of people already voted and so the thing that should happen is we should wait."\n
Joe Biden: "We should wait and see what the outcome of this election is because that’s the only way the American people get to express their view is by who they elect as President and who they elect as Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "Now, what’s at stake here is the President’s made it clear, he wants to get rid of the Affordable Care Act."\n

Chris Wallace: "You have two minutes."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, thank you for doing this and looking forward to this, Mr. President."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you, Joe."\n
Joe Biden: "The American people have a right to have a say in who the Supreme Court nominee is and that say occurs when they vote for United States Senators and when they vote for the President of United States."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re not going to get that chance now because we’re in the middle of an election already."\n
Joe Biden: "The election has already started."\n
Joe Biden: "Tens of thousands of people already voted and so the thing that should happen is we should wait."\n
Joe Biden: "We should wait and see what the outcome of this election is because that’s the only way the American people get to express their view is by who they elect as President and who they elect as Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "Now, what’s at stake here is the President’s made it clear, he wants to get rid of the Affordable Care Act."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s been running on that, he ran on that and he’s been governing on that."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s in the Supreme Court right now trying to get rid of the Affordable Care Act, which will strip 20 million people from having health insurance now, if it goes into court."\n
 n000039b07p4046 50000 5 not_related neither 80000 4 not_related neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, thank you for doing this and looking forward to this, Mr. President."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you, Joe."\n
Joe Biden: "The American people have a right to have a say in who the Supreme Court nominee is and that say occurs when they vote for United States Senators and when they vote for the President of United States."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re not going to get that chance now because we’re in the middle of an election already."\n
Joe Biden: "The election has already started."\n
Joe Biden: "Tens of thousands of people already voted and so the thing that should happen is we should wait."\n
Joe Biden: "We should wait and see what the outcome of this election is because that’s the only way the American people get to express their view is by who they elect as President and who they elect as Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "Now, what’s at stake here is the President’s made it clear, he wants to get rid of the Affordable Care Act."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s been running on that, he ran on that and he’s been governing on that."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s in the Supreme Court right now trying to get rid of the Affordable Care Act, which will strip 20 million people from having health insurance now, if it goes into court."\n
Joe Biden: "And the justice, I’m not opposed to the justice, she seems like a very fine person."\n
Joe Biden: "But she’s written, before she went in the bench, which is her right, that she thinks that the Affordable Care Act is not Constitutional."\n
Joe Biden: "The other thing that’s on the court, and if it’s struck down, what happens?"\n
Joe Biden: "Women’s rights are fundamentally changed."\n
Joe Biden: "Once again, a woman could pay more money because she has a pre-existing condition of pregnancy."\n

Joe Biden: "The American people have a right to have a say in who the Supreme Court nominee is and that say occurs when they vote for United States Senators and when they vote for the President of United States."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re not going to get that chance now because we’re in the middle of an election already."\n
Joe Biden: "The election has already started."\n
Joe Biden: "Tens of thousands of people already voted and so the thing that should happen is we should wait."\n
Joe Biden: "We should wait and see what the outcome of this election is because that’s the only way the American people get to express their view is by who they elect as President and who they elect as Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "Now, what’s at stake here is the President’s made it clear, he wants to get rid of the Affordable Care Act."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s been running on that, he ran on that and he’s been governing on that."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s in the Supreme Court right now trying to get rid of the Affordable Care Act, which will strip 20 million people from having health insurance now, if it goes into court."\n
Joe Biden: "And the justice, I’m not opposed to the justice, she seems like a very fine person."\n
Joe Biden: "But she’s written, before she went in the bench, which is her right, that she thinks that the Affordable Care Act is not Constitutional."\n
Joe Biden: "The other thing that’s on the court, and if it’s struck down, what happens?"\n
Joe Biden: "Women’s rights are fundamentally changed."\n
Joe Biden: "Once again, a woman could pay more money because she has a pre-existing condition of pregnancy."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re able to charge women more for the same exact procedure a man gets."\n
Joe Biden: "And that ended when we, in fact, passed the Affordable Care Act, and there’s a hundred million people who have pre-existing conditions and they’ll be taken away as well."\n

Joe Biden: "But she’s written, before she went in the bench, which is her right, that she thinks that the Affordable Care Act is not Constitutional."\n
Joe Biden: "The other thing that’s on the court, and if it’s struck down, what happens?"\n
Joe Biden: "Women’s rights are fundamentally changed."\n
Joe Biden: "Once again, a woman could pay more money because she has a pre-existing condition of pregnancy."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re able to charge women more for the same exact procedure a man gets."\n
Joe Biden: "And that ended when we, in fact, passed the Affordable Care Act, and there’s a hundred million people who have pre-existing conditions and they’ll be taken away as well."\n
Joe Biden: "Those pre-existing conditions, insurance companies are going to love this."\n
Joe Biden: "And so it’s just not appropriate to do this before this election."\n
Joe Biden: "If he wins the election and the Senate is Republican, then he goes forward."\n
Joe Biden: "If not, we should wait until February."\n
Donald Trump: "There aren’t a hundred million people with pre-existing conditions."\n
Donald Trump: "As far as a say is concerned, the people already had their say."\n
Donald Trump: "Okay, Justice Ginsburg said very powerfully, very strongly, at some point 10 years ago or so, she said a President and the Senate is elected for a period of time, but a President is elected for four years."\n
Donald Trump: "We’re not elected for three years."\n
Donald Trump: "I’m not elected for three years."\n

Joe Biden: "He went in and we were insisting that the people we had in the ground in China should be able to go to Wuhan and determine for themselves how dangerous this was."\n
Joe Biden: "He did not even ask Xi to do that."\n
Donald Trump: "Wrong."\n

Chris Wallace: "Are they both wrong?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, I’ve spoken to the companies and we can have it a lot sooner."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s a very political thing because people like this would rather make it political than save lives."\n

Donald Trump: "Which by the way, was given to me by the Obama administration, if you can believe that."\n

Donald Trump: "I don’t want to pay tax."\n
Donald Trump: "Before I came here, I was a private developer, I was a private business people."\n
Donald Trump: "Like every other private person, unless they’re stupid, they go through the laws, and that’s what it is."\n

Donald Trump: "We build the building and we get tax credits, like the hotel on Pennsylvania Avenue."\n
Donald Trump: "Which by the way, was given to me by the Obama administration, if you can believe that."\n
Donald Trump: "Now the man got fired right after that happened, but that’s-"\n

Joe Biden: "Yeah, I do want to respond."\n
Joe Biden: "Look, the tax code that put him in a position that he pays less tax than on the money a school teacher makes is because of him… He says he’s smart because he can take advantage of the tax code."\n
Joe Biden: "And he does take advantage of the tax code."\n

 n000826b07p2528 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 3 Trump's statement is about the failure of Biden support 60000 3 not_related neither
Chris Wallace: "Mr. President, we’re talking about the economy."\n
Chris Wallace: "I’d like to ask you about your plans going forward because Mr. Vice President, your economic plan-"\n
Donald Trump: "He has none."\n
Chris Wallace: "… if you were to be elected president focuses a lot on big government, big taxes, big spending."\n
Chris Wallace: "I want to focus first on the taxes."\n
Chris Wallace: "You propose more than $4 trillion over a decade in new taxes on individuals making more than $400,000 a year."\n
Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
 n000833b07p3440 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 90000 5 Completing the first statement with a supporting phrase on the second statement support 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Chris Wallace: "Mr. President, we’re talking about the economy."\n
Chris Wallace: "I’d like to ask you about your plans going forward because Mr. Vice President, your economic plan-"\n
Donald Trump: "He has none."\n
Chris Wallace: "… if you were to be elected president focuses a lot on big government, big taxes, big spending."\n
Chris Wallace: "I want to focus first on the taxes."\n
Chris Wallace: "You propose more than $4 trillion over a decade in new taxes on individuals making more than $400,000 a year."\n
Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
 n000833b07p3540 80000 4 not_related neither 60000 3 these sentences are clearly supporting each other support 40000 5 For me, this is "support," because it shows that this is a good proposal from Joe to the Americans. support
Chris Wallace: "… if you were to be elected president focuses a lot on big government, big taxes, big spending."\n
Chris Wallace: "I want to focus first on the taxes."\n
Chris Wallace: "You propose more than $4 trillion over a decade in new taxes on individuals making more than $400,000 a year."\n
Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
Joe Biden: "It shouldn’t be 21%."\n
Joe Biden: "You have 91 companies federal, I mean, the fortune 500, who don’t pay a single penny in tax making billions of dollars."\n
Donald Trump: "Why didn’t you do it before, when you were vice president with Obama?"\n

Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
Joe Biden: "It shouldn’t be 21%."\n
Joe Biden: "You have 91 companies federal, I mean, the fortune 500, who don’t pay a single penny in tax making billions of dollars."\n
Donald Trump: "Why didn’t you do it before, when you were vice president with Obama?"\n
 n000836b07p3742 60000 3 These sentences are an providing argument. attack 40000 5 not_related neither 80000 4 Biden Tax Proposal on companies federal support
Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
Joe Biden: "It shouldn’t be 21%."\n
Joe Biden: "You have 91 companies federal, I mean, the fortune 500, who don’t pay a single penny in tax making billions of dollars."\n
Donald Trump: "Why didn’t you do it before, when you were vice president with Obama?"\n
Joe Biden: "Because you in fact passed that, that was your tax proposal."\n
Donald Trump: "I got it done."\n
Donald Trump: "And you know what happened?"\n
 n000839b07p3942 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 support sentence. support 70000 5 provide support on the statements support
Chris Wallace: "… on individuals making more than $400,000 a year and on corporations."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump says that that kind of an increase in taxes is going to hurt the economy as it’s just coming out of a recession."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, just take a look at what is the analysis done by Wall Street firms, points out that my economic plan would create 7 million more jobs than his in four years, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "And number two, it would create an additional $1 trillion in economic growth, because it would be about buying American."\n
Joe Biden: "The federal government spends $600 billion a year on everything from ships, to steel, to buildings and the like."\n
Joe Biden: "And under my proposal, we’re going to make sure that every penny of that has to be made by a company-"\n
Chris Wallace: "But respectfully, sir, I’m talking about taxes, not spending."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, I’m going to eliminate a significant number of the taxes."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m going to make the corporate tax 28%."\n
Joe Biden: "It shouldn’t be 21%."\n
Joe Biden: "You have 91 companies federal, I mean, the fortune 500, who don’t pay a single penny in tax making billions of dollars."\n
Donald Trump: "Why didn’t you do it before, when you were vice president with Obama?"\n
Joe Biden: "Because you in fact passed that, that was your tax proposal."\n
Donald Trump: "I got it done."\n
Donald Trump: "And you know what happened?"\n

Chris Wallace: "The issue of rice."\n
Chris Wallace: "Vice-President Biden, you say that President Trump’s response to the violence in Charlottesville three years ago, when he talked about very fine people on both sides, was what directly led you to launch this run for president."\n
Donald Trump: "Oh yeah, sure."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump, you have often said that you believe you will have done more for Black Americans than any president with the possible exception of Abraham Lincoln."\n
Donald Trump: "That’s true."\n

Donald Trump: "Oh yeah, sure."\n
Chris Wallace: "President Trump, you have often said that you believe you will have done more for Black Americans than any president with the possible exception of Abraham Lincoln."\n
Donald Trump: "That’s true."\n
Chris Wallace: "My question for the two of you, is why should voters trust you rather than your opponent to deal with the race issues facing this country over the next four years?"\n
Chris Wallace: "Vice President Biden, you go first."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s about equity and equality."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s about decency."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s about the constitution."\n
Joe Biden: "And we have never walked away from trying to require equity for everyone, equality for the whole of America."\n
Joe Biden: "But we’ve never accomplished it, but we’ve never walked away from it like he has done."\n
Joe Biden: "It is true, the reason I got in the race is when those people… Close your eyes, remember what those people look like coming out of the fields, carrying torches, their veins bulging, just spewing anti-Semitic bile and accompanied by the Ku Klux Klan."\n

Joe Biden: "He said, “There were very fine people on both sides.” No president’s ever said anything like that."\n
Joe Biden: "[crosstalk 00:27:10]."\n

Chris Wallace: "Vice President Biden, after the grand jury in the Breonna Taylor case decided not to charge any of the police with homicide, you said it raises the question, “Whether justice could be equally applied in America.” Do you believe that there is a separate but unequal system of justice for Blacks in this country?"\n
Joe Biden: "Yes, there is."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s systemic injustice in this country, in education and work and in law enforcement and the way in which it’s enforced."\n
Joe Biden: "But look, the vast majority of police officers are good, decent, honorable men and women."\n
Joe Biden: "They risk their lives every day to take care of us, but there are some bad apples."\n

Chris Wallace: "That’s exactly my question."\n
Chris Wallace: "There has been a dramatic increase in homicides in America this summer particularly, and you often blame that on democratic mayors and democratic governors."\n
Chris Wallace: "But in fact, there have been equivalent spikes in Republican led cities, like Tulsa and Fort Worth."\n
Chris Wallace: "So the question is, is this really a…"\n
Chris Wallace: "It’s like Tulsa and Fort worth."\n
Chris Wallace: "So the question is, is this really a party issue?"\n
Donald Trump: "I think as a party issue, you can bring in a couple of examples but if you look at Chicago, what’s going on in Chicago where a 53 people were shot and eight died shot, if you look at New York where it’s going up, like nobody’s ever seen anything."\n
Donald Trump: "The numbers are going up a 100%, 150%, 200% crime, it is crazy what’s going on and he doesn’t want to say law and order because he can’t because he’ll lose his radical left supporters and once he does that, it’s over with."\n
Donald Trump: "But if he ever got to run this country and they ran it the way he would want to run it, we would have by the way our suburbs would be gone."\n
Donald Trump: "And you would see problems like you’ve never seen before."\n
Joe Biden: "He wouldn’t know a suburb unless you took a wrong turn."\n
Donald Trump: "Oh, I know suburbs so much that you."\n
Chris Wallace: "Gentlemen wait a minute."\n
Joe Biden: "I was raised in the suburbs."\n
Joe Biden: "This is not 1950."\n

Chris Wallace: "I do want to talk about this issue of law and order though."\n
Chris Wallace: "And in the joint recommendation that came from the Biden-Bernie Sanders task force, you talked about quote re-imagining policing."\n
Chris Wallace: "First of all, what does re-imagining policing mean and do you support?"\n
Chris Wallace: "If I might finish the question, what does re-imagining policing mean and do you support the Black Lives Matter call for community control of policing?"\n
Joe Biden: "Look, what I support are the police having the opportunity to deal with the problems they face and I’m totally opposed to defunding the police offices."\n
Joe Biden: "As a matter of fact police, local police, the only one defunding in his budget calls for a $400 million cut in local law enforcement assistance."\n
Joe Biden: "They need more assistance."\n
Joe Biden: "They need when they show up for a 9-11 call to have someone with them as a psychologist or psychiatrist to keep them from having to use force and be able to talk people down."\n
Joe Biden: "We have to have community policing like we had before where the officers get to know the people in the communities."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s when crime went down, it didn’t go up."\n
Joe Biden: "It went down."\n

Chris Wallace: "The question I have though is as the democratic nominee, and earlier tonight, you said that you are the Democratic Party right now, have you ever called the Democratic Mayor of Portland or the Democratic Governor of Oregon and said, “Hey, you got to stop this, bring in the National Guard, do whatever it takes, but you’d stop the days and months of violence in Portland.”"\n

Chris Wallace: "You have rolled back a number of Obama Environmental records, what do you believe about the science of climate change and what will you do in the next four years to confront it?"\n

 n010391b07p9394 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 incomplete neither 10000 4 The second sentence added positive claim to the first sentence support
Chris Wallace: "You have rolled back a number of Obama Environmental records, what do you believe about the science of climate change and what will you do in the next four years to confront it?"\n
Donald Trump: "I want crystal clean water and air."\n
Donald Trump: "I want beautiful clean air."\n
Donald Trump: "We have now the lowest carbon… If you look at our numbers right now, we are doing phenomenally."\n
Donald Trump: "But I haven’t destroyed our businesses."\n
Donald Trump: "Our businesses aren’t put out of commission."\n
Donald Trump: "If you look at the Paris Accord, it was a disaster from our standpoint."\n
Donald Trump: "And people are actually very happy about what’s going on because our businesses are doing well."\n
Donald Trump: "As far as the fires are concerned, you need forest management."\n
Donald Trump: "In addition to everything else, the forest floors are loaded up with trees, dead trees that are years old and they’re like tinder and leaves and everything else."\n
Donald Trump: "You drop a cigarette in there the whole forest burns down."\n
Donald Trump: "You’ve got to have forest management."\n
Chris Wallace: "What do you believe about the science of climate change, sir?"\n
Donald Trump: "I believe that we have to do everything we can to have immaculate air immaculate water and do whatever else we can that’s good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’re planting a billion trees, the Billion Tree Project and it’s very exciting for a lot of people."\n

Donald Trump: "In addition to everything else, the forest floors are loaded up with trees, dead trees that are years old and they’re like tinder and leaves and everything else."\n
Donald Trump: "You drop a cigarette in there the whole forest burns down."\n
Donald Trump: "You’ve got to have forest management."\n
Chris Wallace: "What do you believe about the science of climate change, sir?"\n
Donald Trump: "I believe that we have to do everything we can to have immaculate air immaculate water and do whatever else we can that’s good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’re planting a billion trees, the Billion Tree Project and it’s very exciting for a lot of people."\n
Chris Wallace: "You believe that human pollution, gas, greenhouse gas emissions contributes to the global warming of this planet."\n
Donald Trump: "I think a lot of things do, but I think to an extent, yes."\n
Donald Trump: "I think to an extent, yes, but I also think we have to do better management of our forest."\n
Donald Trump: "Every year I get the call."\n
Donald Trump: "California’s burning, California’s burning."\n
Donald Trump: "If that was cleaned, if that were, if you had forest management, good forest management, you wouldn’t be getting those calls."\n
Donald Trump: "In Europe, they live they’re forest cities."\n
Donald Trump: "They call forest cities."\n
Donald Trump: "They maintain their forest."\n
 n010406b07p0607 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 sentences are clearly supporting each other and you would only know this from the context. support 90000 5 incomplete neither
Donald Trump: "In Europe, they live they’re forest cities."\n
Donald Trump: "They call forest cities."\n
Donald Trump: "They maintain their forest."\n
Donald Trump: "They manage their forest."\n
Donald Trump: "I was with the head of a major country, it’s a forest city."\n
Donald Trump: "He said, “Sir, we have trees that are far more, they ignite much easier than California."\n
Donald Trump: "There shouldn’t be that problem.” I spoke with the Governor about it."\n
Donald Trump: "I’m getting along very well with the governor."\n
Donald Trump: "But I said, “At some point you can’t every year have hundreds of thousands of acres of land just burned to the ground.” That’s burning down because of a lack of management."\n
Chris Wallace: "But sir if you believe in the science of climate change, why have you rolled back the Obama Clean Power Plan which limited carbon emissions and power plants?"\n
Chris Wallace: "Why have you relaxed…?"\n
Donald Trump: "Because it was driving energy prices through the sky."\n
Joe Biden: "Why have you relaxed fuel economy standards that are going to create more pollution from cars and trucks?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, not really because what’s happening is the car is much less expensive and it’s a much safer car and you talk it about a tiny difference."\n
Donald Trump: "And then what would happen because of the cost of the car you would have at least double and triple the number of cars purchased."\n

Chris Wallace: "Why have you relaxed…?"\n
Donald Trump: "Because it was driving energy prices through the sky."\n
Joe Biden: "Why have you relaxed fuel economy standards that are going to create more pollution from cars and trucks?"\n

Donald Trump: "They manage their forest."\n
Donald Trump: "I was with the head of a major country, it’s a forest city."\n
Donald Trump: "He said, “Sir, we have trees that are far more, they ignite much easier than California."\n
Donald Trump: "There shouldn’t be that problem.” I spoke with the Governor about it."\n
Donald Trump: "I’m getting along very well with the governor."\n
Donald Trump: "But I said, “At some point you can’t every year have hundreds of thousands of acres of land just burned to the ground.” That’s burning down because of a lack of management."\n
Chris Wallace: "But sir if you believe in the science of climate change, why have you rolled back the Obama Clean Power Plan which limited carbon emissions and power plants?"\n
Chris Wallace: "Why have you relaxed…?"\n
Donald Trump: "Because it was driving energy prices through the sky."\n
Joe Biden: "Why have you relaxed fuel economy standards that are going to create more pollution from cars and trucks?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, not really because what’s happening is the car is much less expensive and it’s a much safer car and you talk it about a tiny difference."\n
Donald Trump: "And then what would happen because of the cost of the car you would have at least double and triple the number of cars purchased."\n
Donald Trump: "We have the old slugs out there that are 10, 12 years old."\n
Donald Trump: "If you did that, the car would be safer."\n
Donald Trump: "It would be much cheaper by $3,500."\n

Chris Wallace: "The president says a lot of these things would tank the economy and cost millions of jobs."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s absolutely wrong, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, if in fact, during our administration in the recovery act, I was in charge able to bring down the cost of renewable energy to cheaper than are as cheap as coal and gas and oil."\n
Joe Biden: "Nobody’s going to build another coal fired plant in America."\n

Joe Biden: "They’re going to move to renewable energy."\n

Joe Biden: "Making sure that we can do that, we’re going to put 500,000 charging stations in all of the highways that we’re going to be building in the future."\n

Joe Biden: "Make sure it’s totally transparent."\n
Joe Biden: "Have the scientists of the world see it, know it, look at it, go through all the processes."\n

Joe Biden: "You need to be in a position where you can take testing rapidly and know whether the person is in fact infected."\n

Joe Biden: "You need to be able to provide all the resources that are needed to do this."\n

Joe Biden: "And that is not inconsistent with saying that we’re going to make sure that we’re going to open safely."\n
Joe Biden: "And by the way, all you teachers out there, not that many of you are going to die, so don’t worry about it."\n

Joe Biden: "Come on."\n
Kristen Welker: "President Trump, let me follow up with you quickly."\n

Joe Biden: "He was told this was a serious virus that spread in the air, and it was much worse, much worse, than the flu."\n
Joe Biden: "He went on record and said to one of your colleagues, recorded, that in fact he knew how dangerous it was but he didn’t want to tell us."\n
Joe Biden: "He didn’t want to tell us because he didn’t want us to panic."\n
Joe Biden: "He didn’t want us… Americans don’t panic."\n
Joe Biden: "He panicked."\n

Joe Biden: "They’re interfering with American sovereignty."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what’s going on right now."\n

Kristen Welker: "This question goes to you, Mr. Vice President."\n
Kristen Welker: "What would you do to put an end to this threat?"\n
Kristen Welker: "You have two minutes, uninterrupted."\n
Joe Biden: "I made it clear and I asked everyone else to take the pledge."\n
Joe Biden: "I made it clear that any country, no matter who it is, that interferes in American elections will pay a price."\n
Joe Biden: "They will pay a price."\n
Joe Biden: "And it’s been overwhelmingly clear this election — I won’t even get into the last one — this election, that Russia has been involved, China’s been involved to some degree, and now we learn that Iran is involved."\n
Joe Biden: "They will pay a price if I’m elected."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re interfering with American sovereignty."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what’s going on right now."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re interfering with American sovereignty."\n
Joe Biden: "And to the best of my knowledge, I don’t think the President has said anything to Putin about it."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t think he’s talking to them a lot."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t think he’s said a word."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t know why he hasn’t said a word to Putin about it, and I don’t know what he has recently said, if anything, to the Iranians."\n

Joe Biden: "He’s being fed information that is Russian that is not true."\n
Joe Biden: "And then what happens?"\n
Joe Biden: "Nothing happens."\n
Joe Biden: "And then you find out that everything that’s going on here, about Russia is wanting to make sure that I do not get elected the next President of the United States, because they know I know them, and they know me."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t understand why this President is unwilling to take on Putin when he’s actually paying bounties to kill American soldiers in Afghanistan, when he’s engaged in activities that are trying to destabilize all of NATO."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t know why he doesn’t do it, but it’s worth asking the question."\n
Joe Biden: "Why isn’t that being done?"\n
Joe Biden: "Any country that interferes with us will, in fact, pay a price, because they’re affecting our sovereignty."\n

Joe Biden: "And then what happens?"\n
Joe Biden: "Nothing happens."\n
Joe Biden: "And then you find out that everything that’s going on here, about Russia is wanting to make sure that I do not get elected the next President of the United States, because they know I know them, and they know me."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t understand why this President is unwilling to take on Putin when he’s actually paying bounties to kill American soldiers in Afghanistan, when he’s engaged in activities that are trying to destabilize all of NATO."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t know why he doesn’t do it, but it’s worth asking the question."\n
Joe Biden: "Why isn’t that being done?"\n
Joe Biden: "Any country that interferes with us will, in fact, pay a price, because they’re affecting our sovereignty."\n
Kristen Welker: "President Trump, same question to you."\n

Kristen Welker: "You’re going to have two minutes to respond."\n
Kristen Welker: "For two elections in a row now, there has been substantial interference from foreign adversaries."\n
Kristen Welker: "What would you do in your next term to put an end to this?"\n
Kristen Welker: "Two minutes, uninterrupted."\n
Donald Trump: "Well, let me respond to the first part, as Joe answered."\n
Donald Trump: "Joe got $3.5 million from Russia and it came through Putin, because he was very friendly with the former mayor of Moscow and it was the mayor of Moscow’s wife."\n
Donald Trump: "And you got $3.5 million."\n
Donald Trump: "Your family got $3.5 million."\n
Donald Trump: "And someday you’re going to have to explain, why did you get three and a half?"\n

Kristen Welker: "Vice-President Biden, there have been questions about the work your son has done in China and for a Ukrainian energy company when you were vice-president, in retrospect, was anything about those relationships inappropriate or unethical?"\n
Joe Biden: "Nothing was unethical."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s what the deal."\n
Joe Biden: "With regard to Ukraine."\n
Joe Biden: "We had this whole question about whether or not, because he was on the board, I later learned of Burisma, a company that somehow, I had done something wrong, yet every single solitary person, when he was going through his impeachment, testifying under oath, who work for him, said I did my job impeccably."\n
Joe Biden: "I carried out U.S. policy, not one single solitary thing was out of line, not a single thing, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, the guy who got in trouble in Ukraine was this guy trying to bribe the Ukrainian government to say something negative about me, which they would not do and did not do because it never ever, ever happened."\n
Joe Biden: "My son has not made money in terms of this thing about, what are you talking about, China."\n
Joe Biden: "I have not had… the only guy who made money from China is this guy."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s the only one."\n

 n020595b07p9299 90000 5 incomplete neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 4 not_related neither
Joe Biden: "We are making sure that in order to do business in China, you have to give all your intellectual property."\n
Joe Biden: "You have to have a partner in China."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s 51%, we would not do that at all, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, we’re in a situation where China would have to play by the rules internationally as well."\n
Joe Biden: "When I met with Xi and when I was still vice-president, he said we’re setting up air identification zones in the South China Sea."\n
Joe Biden: "You can’t fly through them."\n
Joe Biden: "I said we’re going to fly through them."\n
Joe Biden: "We just flew B-52, B-1 bombers through it."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re not going to pay attention."\n
Joe Biden: "They have to play by the rules."\n
Joe Biden: "And what’s he do?"\n
Joe Biden: "He embraces guys like the thugs, like in North Korea and the Chinese president and Putin and others, and he pokes his finger [inaudible 00:10:36] all of our friends, all of our allies."\n
Joe Biden: "We make up only… we’re 25%, 25% of the world’s economy."\n
Joe Biden: "We need to be having the rest of our friends with us saying to China, “These are the rules."\n
Joe Biden: "You play by them, or you’re going to pay the price for not paying by them economically.”"\n

Joe Biden: "If you’re a middle-class family, you’re getting hurt badly right now."\n
Joe Biden: "You’re sitting at the kitchen table this morning deciding, “Well, we can’t get new tires."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re bald, because we have to wait another month or so.” Or, “Are we going to be able to pay the mortgage?” Or, “Who’s going to tell her she can’t go back to community college?” They’re the decisions you’re making, and the middle-class families like I grew up in Scranton and Claymont, they’re in trouble."\n

Joe Biden: "What I’m going to do is pass Obamacare with a public option, and become Bidencare."\n
Joe Biden: "The public option is an option that says that if you in fact do not have the wherewithal, if you qualify for Medicaid and you do not have the wherewithal in your state to get Medicaid, you automatically are enrolled, providing competition for insurance companies."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what’s going to happen."\n
Joe Biden: "Secondly, we’re going to make sure we reduce the premiums and reduce drug prices by making sure that there’s competition, that doesn’t exist now, by allowing Medicare to negotiate drug prices with the insurance companies."\n
Joe Biden: "Thirdly, the idea that I want to eliminate private insurance, the reason why I had such a fight with 20 candidates for the nomination was I support private insurance."\n

Joe Biden: "He thinks he’s running against somebody else."\n
Joe Biden: "He’s running against Joe Biden."\n
Joe Biden: "I beat all those other people because I disagreed with them."\n
Joe Biden: "Joe Biden, he’s running against."\n

Joe Biden: "“If in fact he continues his plan to withhold the tax on Social Security, Social Security will be bankrupt by 2023 with no way to make up for it.” This is the guy who’s tried to cut Medicare."\n

Kristen Welker: "Let me follow up with you, Vice President Biden because-"\n
Donald Trump: "If we made a deal, the Republicans will pass it."\n
Kristen Welker: "Let me ask Vice President Biden a question."\n
Kristen Welker: "You are the leader of the Democratic party."\n
Kristen Welker: "Why have you not pushed the Democrats to get a deal for the American people?"\n
Joe Biden: "I have, and they have pushed it."\n
Joe Biden: "Look, they passed this act all the way back in the beginning of the summer."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s not new."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s been out there."\n
Joe Biden: "This HEROES Act has been sitting there."\n
Joe Biden: "And look at what’s happening."\n

Joe Biden: "Well, guess what, we have never, ever lived up to it."\n

Kristen Welker: "Mr. Vice President, in the next two minutes, I want you to speak directly to these families."\n
Kristen Welker: "Do you understand why these parents fear for their children?"\n
Donald Trump: "I do."\n
Donald Trump: "I do."\n
Joe Biden: "My daughter is a social worker and she’s written a lot about this."\n
Joe Biden: "She has her graduate degree from the University of Pennsylvania in social work."\n
Joe Biden: "And one of the reasons why I ended up working on the East Side of Wilmington, Delaware, which is 90% African-American, was to learn more about what was going on."\n
Joe Biden: "I never had to tell my daughter if she’s pulled over, make sure she puts… For a traffic stop."\n
Joe Biden: "“Put both hands on top of the wheel and don’t reach for the glove box because someone may shoot you.” But a Black parent, no matter how wealthy or how poor they are, has to teach their child, “When you’re walking down the street, don’t have a hoodie on when you go across the street."\n
Joe Biden: "Making sure that you, in fact, if you get pulled over just, yes, sir, no, sir."\n
Joe Biden: "Hands on top of the wheel."\n
Joe Biden: "Because you are in fact, the victim, whether you’re a person making 300,000 … child of a $300,000 a year person or someone who’s on food stamps."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is, there is institutional racism in America."\n
Joe Biden: "And we have always said, we’ve never lived up to it, that we hold these truths to be self-evident, all men and women are created equal."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, guess what, we have never, ever lived up to it."\n

Joe Biden: "My daughter is a social worker and she’s written a lot about this."\n
Joe Biden: "She has her graduate degree from the University of Pennsylvania in social work."\n
Joe Biden: "And one of the reasons why I ended up working on the East Side of Wilmington, Delaware, which is 90% African-American, was to learn more about what was going on."\n
Joe Biden: "I never had to tell my daughter if she’s pulled over, make sure she puts… For a traffic stop."\n
Joe Biden: "“Put both hands on top of the wheel and don’t reach for the glove box because someone may shoot you.” But a Black parent, no matter how wealthy or how poor they are, has to teach their child, “When you’re walking down the street, don’t have a hoodie on when you go across the street."\n
Joe Biden: "Making sure that you, in fact, if you get pulled over just, yes, sir, no, sir."\n
Joe Biden: "Hands on top of the wheel."\n
Joe Biden: "Because you are in fact, the victim, whether you’re a person making 300,000 … child of a $300,000 a year person or someone who’s on food stamps."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is, there is institutional racism in America."\n
Joe Biden: "And we have always said, we’ve never lived up to it, that we hold these truths to be self-evident, all men and women are created equal."\n
Joe Biden: "Well, guess what, we have never, ever lived up to it."\n
Joe Biden: "But we’ve always constantly been moving the needle further and further to inclusion, not exclusion."\n
Joe Biden: "This is the first president to come along and says, that’s the end of that."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re not going to do that anymore."\n
Joe Biden: "We have to provide for economic opportunity, better education, better healthcare, better access to schooling, better access to opportunity to borrow money to start businesses, all the things we can do."\n

Joe Biden: "I never had to tell my daughter if she’s pulled over, make sure she puts… For a traffic stop."\n
Joe Biden: "“Put both hands on top of the wheel and don’t reach for the glove box because someone may shoot you.” But a Black parent, no matter how wealthy or how poor they are, has to teach their child, “When you’re walking down the street, don’t have a hoodie on when you go across the street."\n
Joe Biden: "Making sure that you, in fact, if you get pulled over just, yes, sir, no, sir."\n
Joe Biden: "Hands on top of the wheel."\n

Kristen Welker: "I would like you to speak directly to these families, do you understand why these parents fear for their children?"\n
Donald Trump: "Yes, I do."\n
Donald Trump: "And again, he’s been in government 47 years, he never did a thing, except in 1994, when he did such harm to the black community, and they were called … and he called them superpredators."\n
Donald Trump: "And he said that, he said it, superpredators."\n
Donald Trump: "And they never lived that down."\n
Donald Trump: "1994, your crime bill, the superpredators."\n
Donald Trump: "Nobody has done more for the black community than Donald Trump."\n

Donald Trump: "Criminal justice reform, Obama and Joe didn’t do it."\n
Donald Trump: "I don’t even think they tried because they had no chance at doing it."\n

Donald Trump: "It’s one of the most successful programs."\n

Donald Trump: "He came in with this incredible idea for Opportunity Zones."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s one of the most successful programs."\n
Donald Trump: "People don’t talk about it."\n
Donald Trump: "Tremendous investment is being made, biggest beneficiary, the black and Hispanic communities."\n
Donald Trump: "And then Historically Black Colleges and Universities, after three years of coming to the office, I love some of those guys, they were great."\n
Donald Trump: "They came into the office and I said, “What are you doing?” After three years, I said, “Why do you keep coming back?” Because we have no funding.” I said, “You don’t have to come back every year.” “We have to come back.”"\n
Donald Trump: "Because President Obama would never give them long-term funding and I did."\n
Donald Trump: "10 year long-term funding and I gave them more money than they asked for because I said, “I think you need more.” And I said, “The only bad part about this is I may never see you again.” Because I got very friendly with them and they like me and I like them."\n
Donald Trump: "But I saved Historically Black Colleges and Universities."\n
Kristen Welker: "Okay, and we’re going to talk about both of your records, but your response to that Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "My response to that is I never ever said what he accused me of saying."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is in 2000 though, after the crime bill had been in the law for awhile, this is a guy who said, “The problem with the crime bill, there’s not enough people in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s not enough people in jail.” And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, “not enough people.” He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs, and the people who are going to maraud our cities."\n
Joe Biden: "This is a guy who in the Central Park Five, five innocent black kids, he continued to push for making sure that they got the death penalty."\n

Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is in 2000 though, after the crime bill had been in the law for awhile, this is a guy who said, “The problem with the crime bill, there’s not enough people in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s not enough people in jail.” And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, “not enough people.” He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs, and the people who are going to maraud our cities."\n

Joe Biden: "We commuted over 1,000 people’s sentences, over 1,000."\n
Joe Biden: "The very law he’s talking about is a law that in fact, initiated by Barack Obama."\n

Joe Biden: "My response to that is I never ever said what he accused me of saying."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is in 2000 though, after the crime bill had been in the law for awhile, this is a guy who said, “The problem with the crime bill, there’s not enough people in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s not enough people in jail.” And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, “not enough people.” He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs, and the people who are going to maraud our cities."\n
Joe Biden: "This is a guy who in the Central Park Five, five innocent black kids, he continued to push for making sure that they got the death penalty."\n
Joe Biden: "None of them were guilty of the crimes they were suggested."\n
Joe Biden: "Look and granted, he did in fact, let 20 people … he commuted 20 people’s sentences."\n
Joe Biden: "We commuted over 1,000 people’s sentences, over 1,000."\n
Joe Biden: "The very law he’s talking about is a law that in fact, initiated by Barack Obama."\n
Joe Biden: "And secondly, we’re in a situation here where the federal prison system was reduced by 38,000 people under our administration."\n
Joe Biden: "And one of those things we should be doing, there should be no, no minimum mandatories in the law."\n
 n030253b07p4953 40000 5 not_related neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 20000 5 not_related neither
Kristen Welker: "Okay, and we’re going to talk about both of your records, but your response to that Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "My response to that is I never ever said what he accused me of saying."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is in 2000 though, after the crime bill had been in the law for awhile, this is a guy who said, “The problem with the crime bill, there’s not enough people in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s not enough people in jail.” And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, “not enough people.” He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs, and the people who are going to maraud our cities."\n
Joe Biden: "This is a guy who in the Central Park Five, five innocent black kids, he continued to push for making sure that they got the death penalty."\n
Joe Biden: "None of them were guilty of the crimes they were suggested."\n
Joe Biden: "Look and granted, he did in fact, let 20 people … he commuted 20 people’s sentences."\n
Joe Biden: "We commuted over 1,000 people’s sentences, over 1,000."\n
Joe Biden: "The very law he’s talking about is a law that in fact, initiated by Barack Obama."\n
Joe Biden: "And secondly, we’re in a situation here where the federal prison system was reduced by 38,000 people under our administration."\n
Joe Biden: "And one of those things we should be doing, there should be no, no minimum mandatories in the law."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’m offering $20 billion to states to change their state laws to eliminate minimum mandatories and set up drug courts."\n
Joe Biden: "No one should be going to jail because they have a drug problem."\n
Joe Biden: "They should be going to rehabilitation, not to jail."\n
Joe Biden: "We should fundamentally change the system and that’s what I’m going to do."\n

Joe Biden: "My response to that is I never ever said what he accused me of saying."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is in 2000 though, after the crime bill had been in the law for awhile, this is a guy who said, “The problem with the crime bill, there’s not enough people in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "There’s not enough people in jail.” And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, “not enough people.” He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs, and the people who are going to maraud our cities."\n
Joe Biden: "This is a guy who in the Central Park Five, five innocent black kids, he continued to push for making sure that they got the death penalty."\n
Joe Biden: "None of them were guilty of the crimes they were suggested."\n
Joe Biden: "Look and granted, he did in fact, let 20 people … he commuted 20 people’s sentences."\n
Joe Biden: "We commuted over 1,000 people’s sentences, over 1,000."\n
Joe Biden: "The very law he’s talking about is a law that in fact, initiated by Barack Obama."\n
Joe Biden: "And secondly, we’re in a situation here where the federal prison system was reduced by 38,000 people under our administration."\n
Joe Biden: "And one of those things we should be doing, there should be no, no minimum mandatories in the law."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’m offering $20 billion to states to change their state laws to eliminate minimum mandatories and set up drug courts."\n
Joe Biden: "No one should be going to jail because they have a drug problem."\n
Joe Biden: "They should be going to rehabilitation, not to jail."\n
Joe Biden: "We should fundamentally change the system and that’s what I’m going to do."\n
Donald Trump: "But why didn’t he do it four years ago?"\n

Donald Trump: "They remember it because if you look at what’s happening with the voting right now, they remember that you treated them very, very badly, just take a look at what’s happening out there."\n
Kristen Welker: "Let me ask Vice President Biden about… Vice President Biden, let me give you a chance to respond within this context, crime bills that you supported in the ’80s and ’90s contributed to the incarceration of tens of thousands of young Black men who had small amounts of drugs in their possession, they are sons, they are brothers, they are fathers, they are uncles, whose families are still to this day, some of them suffering the consequences."\n
Kristen Welker: "So, speak to those families, why should they vote for you?"\n
Joe Biden: "One of the things is that in the ’80s we passed 100 percent, all 100 senators voted for a bill on drugs and how to deal with drugs, it was a mistake."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been trying to change since then particularly the portion on cocaine."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’ve been arguing that in fact we should not send anyone to jail for a pure drug offense, they should be going into treatment across the board, that’s what we should be spending money."\n
Joe Biden: "And that’s why I set up drug courts which were never funded by our Republican friends."\n
Joe Biden: "They should not be going to jail for a drug or an alcohol problem, they should be going into treatment."\n
 n030351b07p5154 60000 3 The sentences are providing an argument. attack 80000 3 Trump attacks Biden's policy against Drug use attack 50000 5 not_related neither
Joe Biden: "Oh, God."\n
Donald Trump: "Tens of thousands of Black men, mostly, in jail."\n
Joe Biden: "Not true."\n
Kristen Welker: "All right, let me ask Vice President Biden a question."\n
Donald Trump: "And you know what?"\n
Donald Trump: "They remember it because if you look at what’s happening with the voting right now, they remember that you treated them very, very badly, just take a look at what’s happening out there."\n
Kristen Welker: "Let me ask Vice President Biden about… Vice President Biden, let me give you a chance to respond within this context, crime bills that you supported in the ’80s and ’90s contributed to the incarceration of tens of thousands of young Black men who had small amounts of drugs in their possession, they are sons, they are brothers, they are fathers, they are uncles, whose families are still to this day, some of them suffering the consequences."\n
Kristen Welker: "So, speak to those families, why should they vote for you?"\n
Joe Biden: "One of the things is that in the ’80s we passed 100 percent, all 100 senators voted for a bill on drugs and how to deal with drugs, it was a mistake."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been trying to change since then particularly the portion on cocaine."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’ve been arguing that in fact we should not send anyone to jail for a pure drug offense, they should be going into treatment across the board, that’s what we should be spending money."\n
Joe Biden: "And that’s why I set up drug courts which were never funded by our Republican friends."\n
Joe Biden: "They should not be going to jail for a drug or an alcohol problem, they should be going into treatment."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what we’ve been trying to do, that’s what I’m going to get done because I think the American people have now seen that in fact it was a mistake to pass those laws relating to drugs, but they were not in the Crime Bill."\n
Kristen Welker: "[crosstalk 00:11:04]."\n

Kristen Welker: "So, speak to those families, why should they vote for you?"\n
Joe Biden: "One of the things is that in the ’80s we passed 100 percent, all 100 senators voted for a bill on drugs and how to deal with drugs, it was a mistake."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been trying to change since then particularly the portion on cocaine."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’ve been arguing that in fact we should not send anyone to jail for a pure drug offense, they should be going into treatment across the board, that’s what we should be spending money."\n
Joe Biden: "And that’s why I set up drug courts which were never funded by our Republican friends."\n
Joe Biden: "They should not be going to jail for a drug or an alcohol problem, they should be going into treatment."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what we’ve been trying to do, that’s what I’m going to get done because I think the American people have now seen that in fact it was a mistake to pass those laws relating to drugs, but they were not in the Crime Bill."\n
Kristen Welker: "[crosstalk 00:11:04]."\n
Donald Trump: "But, why didn’t he get it done?"\n
Donald Trump: "See, it’s all talk, no action with these politicians, why didn’t he get it?"\n
Donald Trump: "“That’s what I’m going to do when I become president.” You were vice president along with Obama as your president, your leader, for eight years, why didn’t you get it done?"\n
Donald Trump: "You had eight years to get it done, now you’re saying you’re going to get it done because you’re all talking and no action, Joe."\n
Kristen Welker: "Your response."\n
Joe Biden: "We got a lot of it done."\n
Joe Biden: "We released 38,000-"\n

Joe Biden: "One of the things is that in the ’80s we passed 100 percent, all 100 senators voted for a bill on drugs and how to deal with drugs, it was a mistake."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been trying to change since then particularly the portion on cocaine."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s why I’ve been arguing that in fact we should not send anyone to jail for a pure drug offense, they should be going into treatment across the board, that’s what we should be spending money."\n
Joe Biden: "And that’s why I set up drug courts which were never funded by our Republican friends."\n
Joe Biden: "They should not be going to jail for a drug or an alcohol problem, they should be going into treatment."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what we’ve been trying to do, that’s what I’m going to get done because I think the American people have now seen that in fact it was a mistake to pass those laws relating to drugs, but they were not in the Crime Bill."\n

Joe Biden: "We had a Republican Congress, that’s the answer."\n
Kristen Welker: "Okay."\n
Donald Trump: "Well, you got to talk them into it, Joe, sometimes you got to talk them into it."\n
Kristen Welker: "We’re going to move on to our next section which is climate change."\n
Donald Trump: "… like I did with criminal justice reform, I had to talk Democrats into it."\n
Joe Biden: "You did what we already had done."\n
Kristen Welker: "Gentlemen, we’re running out of time so we got to get onto climate change, please."\n
Kristen Welker: "You both have very different visions on climate change."\n
Kristen Welker: "President Trump, you say that environmental regulations have hurt jobs in the energy sector, Vice President Biden, you have said you see addressing climate change as an opportunity to create new jobs."\n
Kristen Welker: "For each of you, how would you both combat climate change and support job growth at the same time?"\n
Kristen Welker: "Starting with you, President Trump, you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Donald Trump: "So, we have the trillion trees program, we have so many different programs, I do love the environment, but what I want is that cleanest crystal clear water, the cleanest air."\n
Donald Trump: "We have the best lowest number in carbon emissions, which is a big standard that I noticed Obama goes with all the time, not Joe, I haven’t heard Joe use the term because I’m not sure he knows what it represents or means, but I have heard Obama use it."\n
Donald Trump: "And we have the best carbon emission numbers that we’ve had in 35 years under this administration, we are working so well with industry, but here’s what we can’t do."\n
Donald Trump: "Look at China, how filthy it is, look at Russia, look at India, it’s filthy, the air is filthy."\n
 n030392b07p9096 50000 5 incomplete neither 80000 4 not_related neither 60000 3 not_related neither
Kristen Welker: "For each of you, how would you both combat climate change and support job growth at the same time?"\n
Kristen Welker: "Starting with you, President Trump, you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Donald Trump: "So, we have the trillion trees program, we have so many different programs, I do love the environment, but what I want is that cleanest crystal clear water, the cleanest air."\n
Donald Trump: "We have the best lowest number in carbon emissions, which is a big standard that I noticed Obama goes with all the time, not Joe, I haven’t heard Joe use the term because I’m not sure he knows what it represents or means, but I have heard Obama use it."\n
Donald Trump: "And we have the best carbon emission numbers that we’ve had in 35 years under this administration, we are working so well with industry, but here’s what we can’t do."\n
Donald Trump: "Look at China, how filthy it is, look at Russia, look at India, it’s filthy, the air is filthy."\n
Donald Trump: "The [Paris Accord 00:00:13:55], I took us out because we were going to have to spend trillions of dollars and we were treated very unfairly."\n
Donald Trump: "When they put us in there, they did us a great disservice, they were going to take away our businesses."\n
Donald Trump: "I will not sacrifice tens of millions of jobs, thousands and thousands of companies because of the Paris Accord, it was so unfair."\n
Donald Trump: "China doesn’t kick in until 2030, Russia goes back to a low standard, and we kicked in right away, it would have been… It would have destroyed our businesses."\n
Donald Trump: "So, you ready?"\n
Donald Trump: "We have done an incredible job environmentally, we have the cleanest air, the cleanest water, and the best carbon emission standards that we’ve seen in many, many years."\n
Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden-"\n
Donald Trump: "And we haven’t destroyed our industries."\n
Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden, two minutes to you uninterrupted."\n

Kristen Welker: "Starting with you, President Trump, you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Donald Trump: "So, we have the trillion trees program, we have so many different programs, I do love the environment, but what I want is that cleanest crystal clear water, the cleanest air."\n
Donald Trump: "We have the best lowest number in carbon emissions, which is a big standard that I noticed Obama goes with all the time, not Joe, I haven’t heard Joe use the term because I’m not sure he knows what it represents or means, but I have heard Obama use it."\n
Donald Trump: "And we have the best carbon emission numbers that we’ve had in 35 years under this administration, we are working so well with industry, but here’s what we can’t do."\n
Donald Trump: "Look at China, how filthy it is, look at Russia, look at India, it’s filthy, the air is filthy."\n
Donald Trump: "The [Paris Accord 00:00:13:55], I took us out because we were going to have to spend trillions of dollars and we were treated very unfairly."\n
Donald Trump: "When they put us in there, they did us a great disservice, they were going to take away our businesses."\n
Donald Trump: "I will not sacrifice tens of millions of jobs, thousands and thousands of companies because of the Paris Accord, it was so unfair."\n
Donald Trump: "China doesn’t kick in until 2030, Russia goes back to a low standard, and we kicked in right away, it would have been… It would have destroyed our businesses."\n
Donald Trump: "So, you ready?"\n

Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden-"\n
Donald Trump: "And we haven’t destroyed our industries."\n
Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden, two minutes to you uninterrupted."\n
Joe Biden: "Climate change, global warming is an existential threat to humanity."\n

Joe Biden: "Four more years of this man eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up… To limit the emissions, will put us in a position where we’re going to be in real trouble."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s where we have a great opportunity."\n

Joe Biden: "Climate change, global warming is an existential threat to humanity."\n
Joe Biden: "We have a moral obligation to deal with it."\n
Joe Biden: "And we’re told by all the leading scientists in the world we don’t have much time, we’re going to pass the point of no return within the next 8 to 10 years."\n
Joe Biden: "Four more years of this man eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up… To limit the emissions, will put us in a position where we’re going to be in real trouble."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s where we have a great opportunity."\n
Joe Biden: "I was able to get both all the environmental organizations as well as the labor, the people worried about jobs, to support my climate plan."\n
Joe Biden: "Because what it does, it will create millions of new good paying jobs, we’re going to invest in, for example, 500,000… Excuse me, 50,000 charging stations on our highways so that we can own the electric car market of the future."\n

Donald Trump: "And we haven’t destroyed our industries."\n
Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden, two minutes to you uninterrupted."\n
Joe Biden: "Climate change, global warming is an existential threat to humanity."\n
Joe Biden: "We have a moral obligation to deal with it."\n
Joe Biden: "And we’re told by all the leading scientists in the world we don’t have much time, we’re going to pass the point of no return within the next 8 to 10 years."\n
Joe Biden: "Four more years of this man eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up… To limit the emissions, will put us in a position where we’re going to be in real trouble."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s where we have a great opportunity."\n
Joe Biden: "I was able to get both all the environmental organizations as well as the labor, the people worried about jobs, to support my climate plan."\n
Joe Biden: "Because what it does, it will create millions of new good paying jobs, we’re going to invest in, for example, 500,000… Excuse me, 50,000 charging stations on our highways so that we can own the electric car market of the future."\n
Joe Biden: "In the meantime, China is doing that."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re going to be in a position where we’re going to see to it that we’re going to take 4 million existing buildings and 2 million existing homes and retrofit them so they don’t leak as much energy, saving hundreds of millions of barrels of…"\n
Joe Biden: "So they don’t leak as much energy saving hundreds of millions of barrels of oil in the process and creating significant number of jobs."\n

Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden-"\n
Donald Trump: "And we haven’t destroyed our industries."\n
Kristen Welker: "Vice President Biden, two minutes to you uninterrupted."\n
Joe Biden: "Climate change, global warming is an existential threat to humanity."\n
Joe Biden: "We have a moral obligation to deal with it."\n
Joe Biden: "And we’re told by all the leading scientists in the world we don’t have much time, we’re going to pass the point of no return within the next 8 to 10 years."\n
Joe Biden: "Four more years of this man eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up… To limit the emissions, will put us in a position where we’re going to be in real trouble."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s where we have a great opportunity."\n
Joe Biden: "I was able to get both all the environmental organizations as well as the labor, the people worried about jobs, to support my climate plan."\n
Joe Biden: "Because what it does, it will create millions of new good paying jobs, we’re going to invest in, for example, 500,000… Excuse me, 50,000 charging stations on our highways so that we can own the electric car market of the future."\n
Joe Biden: "In the meantime, China is doing that."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re going to be in a position where we’re going to see to it that we’re going to take 4 million existing buildings and 2 million existing homes and retrofit them so they don’t leak as much energy, saving hundreds of millions of barrels of…"\n
Joe Biden: "So they don’t leak as much energy saving hundreds of millions of barrels of oil in the process and creating significant number of jobs."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, the whole idea of what this is all going to do, it’s going to create millions of jobs and it’s going to clean the environment."\n
Joe Biden: "Our health and our jobs are at stake."\n

Joe Biden: "Climate change, global warming is an existential threat to humanity."\n
Joe Biden: "We have a moral obligation to deal with it."\n
Joe Biden: "And we’re told by all the leading scientists in the world we don’t have much time, we’re going to pass the point of no return within the next 8 to 10 years."\n
Joe Biden: "Four more years of this man eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up… To limit the emissions, will put us in a position where we’re going to be in real trouble."\n
Joe Biden: "Here’s where we have a great opportunity."\n
Joe Biden: "I was able to get both all the environmental organizations as well as the labor, the people worried about jobs, to support my climate plan."\n
Joe Biden: "Because what it does, it will create millions of new good paying jobs, we’re going to invest in, for example, 500,000… Excuse me, 50,000 charging stations on our highways so that we can own the electric car market of the future."\n
Joe Biden: "In the meantime, China is doing that."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re going to be in a position where we’re going to see to it that we’re going to take 4 million existing buildings and 2 million existing homes and retrofit them so they don’t leak as much energy, saving hundreds of millions of barrels of…"\n
Joe Biden: "So they don’t leak as much energy saving hundreds of millions of barrels of oil in the process and creating significant number of jobs."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, the whole idea of what this is all going to do, it’s going to create millions of jobs and it’s going to clean the environment."\n
Joe Biden: "Our health and our jobs are at stake."\n
Joe Biden: "That’s what’s happening and what right now, by the way, Wall Street firms indicated that my plan, my plan will in fact, create 18.6 million jobs, 7 million more than his."\n
Joe Biden: "This is from Wall Street and I’ll create $1 trillion more in economic growth than his proposal does."\n
Joe Biden: "Not on climate, just on economy."\n

Joe Biden: "A hundred trillion dollars, give me a break."\n
Joe Biden: "This plan has been endorsed by every major, every major environmental group and every labor group, labor, because they know the future lies."\n
Joe Biden: "The future lies in us being able to breathe and they know they’re good jobs and getting us there."\n
Joe Biden: "By the way, the fastest growing industry in America is the electric, excuse me, solar energy and wind."\n
Joe Biden: "He thinks wind causes cancer, windmills."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s the fastest growing jobs and they pay good prevailing wages, 45, 50 bucks an hour."\n
Joe Biden: "We can grow and we can be cleaner if we go the route I’m proposing."\n
Kristen Welker: "President Trump-"\n
Donald Trump: "Excuse me."\n
Kristen Welker: "Please respond and then I have his follow up."\n

Donald Trump: "We don’t need all of these countries that we had to fight war over because we needed their energy."\n
Donald Trump: "We are energy independent."\n
Donald Trump: "I know more about wind than you do."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s extremely expensive."\n
Donald Trump: "Kills all the birds."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s very intermittent."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s got a lot of problems and they happen to make the windmills in both Germany and China and the fumes coming up, if you’re a believer in carbon emission, the fumes coming up to make these massive windmills is more than anything that we’re talking about with natural gas, which is very clear."\n
Donald Trump: "One other thing, solar-"\n
Joe Biden: "Find me a scientist who says that."\n
Donald Trump: "I love solar, but solar doesn’t quite have it yet."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s not powerful yet to really run our big, beautiful factories that we need to compete with the world."\n
Joe Biden: "False."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s all a pipe dream, but you know what we’ll do?"\n
Donald Trump: "We’re going to have the greatest economy in the world, but if you want to kill the economy, get rid of your oil industry you want."\n

Joe Biden: "Find me a scientist who says that."\n

Donald Trump: "And what about fracking?"\n
Kristen Welker: "Let me-"\n
Donald Trump: "Now we have to ask him about fracking."\n
Kristen Welker: "Let me allow the Vice President Biden to respond."\n
Joe Biden: "I never said I oppose fracking."\n
Donald Trump: "You said it on tape."\n
Joe Biden: "Show the tape, put it on your website."\n
Donald Trump: "I’ll put it on."\n
Joe Biden: "Put it on the website."\n
Joe Biden: "The fact of the matter is he’s flat lying."\n
Kristen Welker: "Would you rule out about banning fracking?"\n
Joe Biden: "I do rule out banning fracking because the answer we need, we need other industries to transition, to get to ultimately a complete zero emissions by 2025."\n
Joe Biden: "What I will do with fracking over time is make sure that we can capture the emissions from the fracking, capture the emissions from gas."\n
Joe Biden: "We can do that and we can do that by investing money in doing it, but it’s a transition to that."\n
Kristen Welker: "I have one more question in this pile then-"\n

Kristen Welker: "In Texas, there are families who worry the plants near them are making them sick."\n
Kristen Welker: "Your administration has rolled back regulations on these kinds of facilities."\n
Kristen Welker: "Why should these families give you another four years in office?"\n
Donald Trump: "The families that we’re talking about are employed heavily and they are making a lot of money, more money than they’ve ever made."\n
Donald Trump: "If you look at the kind of numbers that we’ve produced for Hispanic, for Black, for Asian, it’s nine times greater the percentage gain than it was under in three years than it was under eight years of the two of them to put it nicely, nine times more."\n
Donald Trump: "Now somebody lives, I have not heard the numbers or the statistics that you’re saying, but they’re making a tremendous amount of money."\n
Donald Trump: "Economically, we saved it and I saved it again a number of months ago, when oil was crashing because of the pandemic."\n
Donald Trump: "We saved it."\n

George Stephanopoulos: "You’re a Democrat."\n
Audience Member 1: "I’m a Democrat."\n
Audience Member 1: "Thank you, George."\n
Audience Member 1: "Mr. Vice President, every day, my wife and I are in disbelief at the lack of coordinated federal action on COVID-19."\n
Audience Member 1: "We know that your administration would follow the science."\n
Audience Member 1: "My question for you, it’s two parts."\n
Audience Member 1: "First, looking backwards to when this country first became aware of COVID-19, what would following the science have meant in terms of actual policy?"\n
Audience Member 1: "And then, looking forward, what would your administration do in terms of following the science with real concrete policies that haven’t been done by the current administration?"\n

Joe Biden: "And all the way back in the beginning of February, I argued that we should be keeping people in China."\n
