George Stephanopoulos: "You’re a Republican who’s voted for Democrats, but you’re not sure what you’re going to do this time around."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Correct?"\n
Audience Member 5: "Correct."\n
Audience Member 8: "Greetings Former Vice President Biden."\n
Joe Biden: "Hello."\n
Audience Member 8: "Thank you, Mr. Stephanopoulos."\n
Audience Member 8: "In a 2012 report of the University of Pittsburgh’s Institute of Politics fracking was discussed and it is possible implications for the waterways from the Commonwealth to the gulf."\n
Audience Member 8: "Fracking has made the population sick and killed wildlife in Southwest Pennsylvania."\n
Audience Member 8: "The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and small business development centers have already begun to transition people away from fossil fuels."\n
Audience Member 8: "What industries that are not harmful to human health and the environment are you planning for Southwest Pennsylvania and the nation?"\n
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, I make it clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I do not propose banning fracking."\n
Joe Biden: "I think you have to make sure that fracking is in fact not emitting methane or polluting the well or dealing with what can be small earthquakes in how they’re drilling."\n
Joe Biden: "So, it has to be managed very, very well, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, what we have to do is the future rests in renewable energy."\n
 n070010b07p1314 90000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 60000 3 other: nan neither
Audience Member 5: "Correct."\n
Audience Member 8: "Greetings Former Vice President Biden."\n
Joe Biden: "Hello."\n
Audience Member 8: "Thank you, Mr. Stephanopoulos."\n
Audience Member 8: "In a 2012 report of the University of Pittsburgh’s Institute of Politics fracking was discussed and it is possible implications for the waterways from the Commonwealth to the gulf."\n
Audience Member 8: "Fracking has made the population sick and killed wildlife in Southwest Pennsylvania."\n
Audience Member 8: "The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and small business development centers have already begun to transition people away from fossil fuels."\n
Audience Member 8: "What industries that are not harmful to human health and the environment are you planning for Southwest Pennsylvania and the nation?"\n
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, I make it clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I do not propose banning fracking."\n
Joe Biden: "I think you have to make sure that fracking is in fact not emitting methane or polluting the well or dealing with what can be small earthquakes in how they’re drilling."\n
Joe Biden: "So, it has to be managed very, very well, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, what we have to do is the future rests in renewable energy."\n
Joe Biden: "The single fastest growing energy source in the world right now, because I’m going to say something that’s going to sound self-serving, but I manage the RecoveryAact and I was able to invest billions of dollars into bringing down the cost per BTU of wind and solar."\n
Joe Biden: "So now it’s cheaper than coal, is cheaper than oil right now, and it has great, great promise."\n
 n070012b07p1415 90000 5 Supporting statements, expresses his approval but with conditions. support 50000 5 Likewise, these sentences are clearly supporting each other and you would only know this from the context. support 70000 5 Sentence supporting each statements support
Audience Member 8: "Greetings Former Vice President Biden."\n
Joe Biden: "Hello."\n
Audience Member 8: "Thank you, Mr. Stephanopoulos."\n
Audience Member 8: "In a 2012 report of the University of Pittsburgh’s Institute of Politics fracking was discussed and it is possible implications for the waterways from the Commonwealth to the gulf."\n
Audience Member 8: "Fracking has made the population sick and killed wildlife in Southwest Pennsylvania."\n
Audience Member 8: "The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and small business development centers have already begun to transition people away from fossil fuels."\n
Audience Member 8: "What industries that are not harmful to human health and the environment are you planning for Southwest Pennsylvania and the nation?"\n
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, I make it clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I do not propose banning fracking."\n
Joe Biden: "I think you have to make sure that fracking is in fact not emitting methane or polluting the well or dealing with what can be small earthquakes in how they’re drilling."\n
Joe Biden: "So, it has to be managed very, very well, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, what we have to do is the future rests in renewable energy."\n
Joe Biden: "The single fastest growing energy source in the world right now, because I’m going to say something that’s going to sound self-serving, but I manage the RecoveryAact and I was able to invest billions of dollars into bringing down the cost per BTU of wind and solar."\n
Joe Biden: "So now it’s cheaper than coal, is cheaper than oil right now, and it has great, great promise."\n
Joe Biden: "And it’s also the fastest growing employer in the energy industry."\n
 n070013b07p1315 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 4 Biden's statement is about fracking support
Audience Member 8: "In a 2012 report of the University of Pittsburgh’s Institute of Politics fracking was discussed and it is possible implications for the waterways from the Commonwealth to the gulf."\n
Audience Member 8: "Fracking has made the population sick and killed wildlife in Southwest Pennsylvania."\n
Audience Member 8: "The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania and small business development centers have already begun to transition people away from fossil fuels."\n
Audience Member 8: "What industries that are not harmful to human health and the environment are you planning for Southwest Pennsylvania and the nation?"\n
Joe Biden: "Well, first of all, I make it clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I do not propose banning fracking."\n
Joe Biden: "I think you have to make sure that fracking is in fact not emitting methane or polluting the well or dealing with what can be small earthquakes in how they’re drilling."\n
Joe Biden: "So, it has to be managed very, very well, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, what we have to do is the future rests in renewable energy."\n
Joe Biden: "The single fastest growing energy source in the world right now, because I’m going to say something that’s going to sound self-serving, but I manage the RecoveryAact and I was able to invest billions of dollars into bringing down the cost per BTU of wind and solar."\n
Joe Biden: "So now it’s cheaper than coal, is cheaper than oil right now, and it has great, great promise."\n
Joe Biden: "And it’s also the fastest growing employer in the energy industry."\n
Joe Biden: "And so there are a number of things that I would do immediately."\n
Joe Biden: "Number one, there are well over 100,000 wells that are left uncapped in the region."\n
Joe Biden: "We could hire 128,000 of these people who are working in the industry to cap these wells and get a good salary doing it now, number one."\n
 n070016b07p1216 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 10000 4 other: nan neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Joe Biden: "The single fastest growing energy source in the world right now, because I’m going to say something that’s going to sound self-serving, but I manage the RecoveryAact and I was able to invest billions of dollars into bringing down the cost per BTU of wind and solar."\n
Joe Biden: "So now it’s cheaper than coal, is cheaper than oil right now, and it has great, great promise."\n
Joe Biden: "And it’s also the fastest growing employer in the energy industry."\n
Joe Biden: "And so there are a number of things that I would do immediately."\n
Joe Biden: "Number one, there are well over 100,000 wells that are left uncapped in the region."\n
Joe Biden: "We could hire 128,000 of these people who are working in the industry to cap these wells and get a good salary doing it now, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "Number two, we should be moving toward finding the new technologies that are going to be able to deal with carbon capture."\n
Joe Biden: "So, ultimately, it’s a transition we moved from, to a net zero emission of carbon that we’re still going to be able to use if we find the right technology, some gases, some gas to be able to, if we can carbon capture."\n
Joe Biden: "And I think we’re going to be able to move in a direction where by the year 2035, we’ll be able to have net zero emissions of carbon from the creation of energy, energy creation so we can move it by dealing with those."\n
Joe Biden: "And every time we talk about global warming or the environment, the president thinks it’s a joke and I think as jobs, because what we’re going to have happened is you’ll be able to see now, as I started to say before."\n
Joe Biden: "I as president is going to invest that $600 billion that we spend in government contracts, only on those things that in fact also are not only made in America, but building an infrastructure that’s clean and new."\n
Joe Biden: "And what we have to do is focus on the transmission of energy across the country from areas relating to solar and wind."\n
Joe Biden: "The reason is that they have not, that has not been mastered yet."\n
Joe Biden: "I met a lot of people in Silicon Valley."\n
Joe Biden: "The battery technology is increasing significantly so you’re going to be able to have, for example, solar on your home and a battery the, this by this by this, as I’m showing you here in your basement."\n

Joe Biden: "So now it’s cheaper than coal, is cheaper than oil right now, and it has great, great promise."\n
Joe Biden: "And it’s also the fastest growing employer in the energy industry."\n
Joe Biden: "And so there are a number of things that I would do immediately."\n
Joe Biden: "Number one, there are well over 100,000 wells that are left uncapped in the region."\n

Joe Biden: "Not possible."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "So, are you for or against it?"\n
George Stephanopoulos: "You say you’re not for it, but in your website, it says you call it a crucial framework, the green deal."\n
Joe Biden: "My deal is a crucial framework, but not the new green deal."\n
Joe Biden: "The new green deal calls for elimination of all non renewable energy by 2030."\n
Joe Biden: "You can’t get there."\n
Joe Biden: "You’re going to need to be able to transition, George, to be able to transition to get to the place where we invest in new technologies that allow us to do things that get us to a place where we get to net zero emission, including in agriculture."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve laid out a detailed plan."\n
Joe Biden: "We should be taking the plan where we allow significant more land to be put in conservation, plant deep rooted plants which absorb carbon from the air and in fact, pay farmers to do it."\n

Joe Biden: "We can do things like pelletize all the chicken manure and all the horse manure and cow manure, and take out the methane and use it as fertilizer and make a lot of money doing it."\n

Audience Member 9: "Welcome to Pennsylvania, Mr. Vice President."\n
Joe Biden: "Good to be back home."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m from Pennsylvania."\n
Audience Member 9: "Yes, I know."\n
Audience Member 9: "Scranton, right?"\n
Joe Biden: "Yep."\n
Audience Member 9: "So, pieces breaking out all over the world."\n
Audience Member 9: "Our troops are coming home."\n
Audience Member 9: "Serbia is talking to Kosovo and the Arabs and Israelis are talking peace which I believe is a modern day miracle what’s going on."\n
Audience Member 9: "Does President Trump’s foreign policy deserves some credit?"\n
Joe Biden: "A little more, but not a whole lot."\n
Joe Biden: "We find ourselves in a position where we’re more isolated in the world than we’ve ever been."\n
Joe Biden: "Our allies-"\n
Joe Biden: "Were more isolated in the world than we ever have been."\n

Joe Biden: "Were more isolated in the world than we ever have been."\n
Joe Biden: "Our allies… Our go it alone, our America first has made America alone."\n
Joe Biden: "You have Iran closer to having enough nuclear material to build a bomb."\n
Joe Biden: "North Korea has more bombs and missiles available to it."\n
Joe Biden: "We find ourselves where our NATO allies are publicly saying they can’t count on us."\n
Joe Biden: "We’re in a situation as well, where in the far East, we find ourselves, in the Western Pacific, where we’re isolated as well."\n
Joe Biden: "You have Japan and South Korea at odds with one another."\n
Joe Biden: "China is making moves."\n
Joe Biden: "So I would say, we’re find ourselves less secure than we’ve been."\n
Joe Biden: "I do compliment the president on the deal with Israel recently."\n
Joe Biden: "But if you take a look, we’re not very well trusted around the world."\n
Joe Biden: "When 17 major nations in the world were asked who they trust more, who’s a better leader, and the president came in behind both, the international survey, both behind Putin, as well as Xi."\n
Joe Biden: "And look what Putin is doing."\n
Joe Biden: "You have bounties on American militaries heads in Afghanistan."\n
Joe Biden: "They have more people there now, by the way, than when we left in Afghanistan."\n

Joe Biden: "And NATO is on the risk of beginning crack because they doubt whether we’re there."\n
Joe Biden: "You see what’s happened in everything from Belarus to Poland, to Hungary, and the rise of totalitarian regimes in the world."\n
Joe Biden: "And as well as, this president embraces all the thugs in the world."\n

Audience Member 10: "I’m good."\n
Joe Biden: "Thank you."\n
Audience Member 10: "I’m the proud mom of two girls, 8 and 10."\n
Audience Member 10: "My youngest daughter is transgender."\n
Audience Member 10: "The Trump administration has attacked the rights of transgender people, banning them from military service, weakening non-discrimination protections, and even removing the word transgender from some government websites."\n
Audience Member 10: "How will you, as president, reverse this dangerous and discriminatory agenda and ensure that the lives and rights of LGBTQ people are protected under US law?"\n
Joe Biden: "I will flat out just change the law."\n
Joe Biden: "Eliminate those executive orders, number one."\n
Joe Biden: "You may recall, I’m the guy who said… I was raised by a man who, I remember, I was being dropped off."\n
Joe Biden: "My dad was a high school educated, well-read man who was a really decent guy."\n
Joe Biden: "And I was being dropped off to get an application in the center of our city, Wilmington, Delaware, the corporate capital of the world at the time."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m getting out to get an application to be a lifeguard in the African-American community, because there was a big swimming pool complex."\n
Joe Biden: "And these two men, well-dressed, leaned up and hugged one another and kissed one another."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m getting out of the car at the light, and I turned to my dad."\n

 n080084b07p8284 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 90000 5 not_related neither
Audience Member 11: "You say that you committed to entering this race after the events of Charlottesville in 2017."\n
Audience Member 11: "I assume that that feeling that prompted you to run will not go away once the results are determined."\n
Audience Member 11: "So hypothetically, if you lose, how will you use your platform to urge President Donald Trump, and those rallying behind him, towards the ideals of a more perfect union?"\n
Joe Biden: "Well, to be very honest with you, I think that’s very hard."\n
Joe Biden: "Things have not let themselves to him learning from what’s happened, what’s gone before."\n
Joe Biden: "Instead of being chastened by being one of the few presidents, the only president to be impeached and then have a member of his own party vote to expel him, it emboldened him."\n
Joe Biden: "But what I will do… Hopefully, I’ll go back to being a professor at the University of Pennsylvania."\n
Joe Biden: "And making the case that I’ve been made, and at the Biden Institute at the University of Delaware, focusing on these same issues, relating to what constitutes decency and honor in this country."\n
Joe Biden: "It’s the thing that got me involved in public life to begin with."\n
Joe Biden: "As a kid, I’d moved from Scranton, where there were no African-Americans and moved down to Claymont, Delaware."\n
Joe Biden: "And in Delaware we have the eight largest Black population, as a percent of population."\n
Joe Biden: "It was an epiphany for me seeing what was going on, and I got deeply involved."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m no great shakes."\n
Joe Biden: "I wasn’t John Lewis."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t mean to imply that."\n

Joe Biden: "As a kid, I’d moved from Scranton, where there were no African-Americans and moved down to Claymont, Delaware."\n
Joe Biden: "And in Delaware we have the eight largest Black population, as a percent of population."\n
Joe Biden: "It was an epiphany for me seeing what was going on, and I got deeply involved."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m no great shakes."\n
Joe Biden: "I wasn’t John Lewis."\n
Joe Biden: "I don’t mean to imply that."\n
Joe Biden: "But it’s the thing that’s motivated… My dad used to have an expression for real."\n
Joe Biden: "He said, “Everyone’s entitled to be treated with dignity."\n
Joe Biden: "Everybody.” And it was real."\n
Joe Biden: "Everybody is."\n
Joe Biden: "And so whether I’m a defeated candidate for president back teaching or I’m elected president, it is a major element of everything that I’m about, because it reflects who we are as a nation."\n
Joe Biden: "Every single solitary generation, the dial has moved closer and closer and more and more to inclusion."\n
Joe Biden: "And we are a country that is a country of slaves who came here 400 years ago, Indigenous people, and everyone else is an immigrant."\n
Joe Biden: "And we’re a diverse country."\n
Joe Biden: "And unless we are able to treat people equally, we’re just never going to meet our potential."\n

George Stephanopoulos: "And we are wrapping up our town hall with former Vice President Joe Biden."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Mr. Vice President, as you know, President Trump had a town hall meeting tonight, as well."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "During that town hall meeting, he was asked several times whether he took a COVID test the day of your last debate."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "You’re supposed to have another debate a week from tonight."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Just two quick questions."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Do you expect that debate to happen?"\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Will you demand that President Trump take a test that day and that it be negative before you debate?"\n
Audience Member 10: "Yeah."\n
Joe Biden: "And by the way, before I came up here, I took another test."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been taking them every day, the deep test, the ones that go in most."\n
Joe Biden: "Because if I had not passed that test, I didn’t want to come here and expose anybody."\n
Joe Biden: "And I just think it’s just decency, to be able to determine whether or not you’re clear."\n
 n100004b07p0811 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 60000 3 not_argumentative neither
George Stephanopoulos: "And we are wrapping up our town hall with former Vice President Joe Biden."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Mr. Vice President, as you know, President Trump had a town hall meeting tonight, as well."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "During that town hall meeting, he was asked several times whether he took a COVID test the day of your last debate."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "You’re supposed to have another debate a week from tonight."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Just two quick questions."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Do you expect that debate to happen?"\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Will you demand that President Trump take a test that day and that it be negative before you debate?"\n
Audience Member 10: "Yeah."\n
Joe Biden: "And by the way, before I came up here, I took another test."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been taking them every day, the deep test, the ones that go in most."\n
Joe Biden: "Because if I had not passed that test, I didn’t want to come here and expose anybody."\n
Joe Biden: "And I just think it’s just decency, to be able to determine whether or not you’re clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m less concerned about me, but then the guys with the cameras, the people working in the Secret Service guys you drive up with, all those people."\n
Joe Biden: "And so, yes, I believe he will do that."\n
 n100006b07p0810 50000 5 incomplete neither 70000 5 Sentence 1 is an introduction for sentence 2 support 80000 4 The two sentences provides information regarding the reason Joe Biden took a test support
George Stephanopoulos: "Mr. Vice President, as you know, President Trump had a town hall meeting tonight, as well."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "During that town hall meeting, he was asked several times whether he took a COVID test the day of your last debate."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "You’re supposed to have another debate a week from tonight."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Just two quick questions."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Do you expect that debate to happen?"\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Will you demand that President Trump take a test that day and that it be negative before you debate?"\n
Audience Member 10: "Yeah."\n
Joe Biden: "And by the way, before I came up here, I took another test."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been taking them every day, the deep test, the ones that go in most."\n
Joe Biden: "Because if I had not passed that test, I didn’t want to come here and expose anybody."\n
Joe Biden: "And I just think it’s just decency, to be able to determine whether or not you’re clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m less concerned about me, but then the guys with the cameras, the people working in the Secret Service guys you drive up with, all those people."\n
Joe Biden: "And so, yes, I believe he will do that."\n
Joe Biden: "Look, I’m going to abide by what the commission rules call for."\n
Joe Biden: "I was prepared to debate him remotely, which was supposed to happen."\n

George Stephanopoulos: "You’re supposed to have another debate a week from tonight."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Just two quick questions."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Do you expect that debate to happen?"\n
George Stephanopoulos: "Will you demand that President Trump take a test that day and that it be negative before you debate?"\n
Audience Member 10: "Yeah."\n
Joe Biden: "And by the way, before I came up here, I took another test."\n
Joe Biden: "I’ve been taking them every day, the deep test, the ones that go in most."\n
Joe Biden: "Because if I had not passed that test, I didn’t want to come here and expose anybody."\n
Joe Biden: "And I just think it’s just decency, to be able to determine whether or not you’re clear."\n
Joe Biden: "I’m less concerned about me, but then the guys with the cameras, the people working in the Secret Service guys you drive up with, all those people."\n
Joe Biden: "And so, yes, I believe he will do that."\n
Joe Biden: "Look, I’m going to abide by what the commission rules call for."\n
Joe Biden: "I was prepared to debate him remotely, which was supposed to happen."\n
Joe Biden: "And he said he wouldn’t do that, a virtual debate, or a town hall."\n
Joe Biden: "He didn’t want to do that."\n

Joe Biden: "I was prepared to debate him remotely, which was supposed to happen."\n
Joe Biden: "And he said he wouldn’t do that, a virtual debate, or a town hall."\n
Joe Biden: "He didn’t want to do that."\n
Joe Biden: "I didn’t set those rules."\n
Joe Biden: "The commission set the rules."\n
Joe Biden: "So whatever rules they set, I’m confident that the Cleveland Clinic is the one overseeing it."\n
Joe Biden: "I think they’re going to not let happen what happened last time."\n
Joe Biden: "They’re going to demand that it’s safe."\n
George Stephanopoulos: "But you expect to be there?"\n
Joe Biden: "I expect to be there."\n

Savannah Guthrie: "I hopefully provided some clarity for folks."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Let’s talk about the event that was held at the White House on the Saturday before you tested positive."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Subsequent to that, 13 people connected to that event tested positive."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "There was an outdoor reception, you’ve seen the pictures."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "There was an indoor reception."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "People were not wearing masks."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "My question to you is, at this point in the pandemic, knowing what we know, shouldn’t you have known better?"\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Shouldn’t the White House know better than to hold an event like that?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, they do a lot of testing in the White House, they test everybody including me, but they test everybody."\n
Donald Trump: "And something happened."\n

 n120115b07p1519 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 incomplete neither 80000 3 not_related neither
Savannah Guthrie: "But that will-"\n
Donald Trump: "But many people are catching it."\n
Donald Trump: "Many people are getting this disease that was sent to us by China, and it shouldn’t have been allowed to happen."\n
Donald Trump: "But many people are getting this."\n
Donald Trump: "And I mean, nobody’s being blamed."\n
Donald Trump: "Everybody is working hard to get this thing out of our country, get it out of the world."\n
Donald Trump: "Look at what’s going on in Europe, massive spikes."\n
Donald Trump: "They’ve done a very good job, but now you take a look today at the UK, you take a look at Spain and France and Italy."\n
Donald Trump: "There’s tremendous spikes."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "But our death rate is worse than, well, not Spain, but those other countries."\n
Donald Trump: "Well, I have thing right here that will tell you exactly the opposite."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Me too."\n
Donald Trump: "The UK is up 2500%, because I knew you’d be doing this."\n

 n120335b07p3639 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 70000 5 provide support on the statements support
Donald Trump: "You’re going to see that."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Well, let me ask… Okay."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "I’m glad you brought up the election, because I do want to ask about that."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "That’s another kind of leftover item."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "A lot of people have asked you, will you accept a peaceful transfer of power?"\n
Savannah Guthrie: "You have said, repeatedly, “The only way we lose this election is, if it is rigged.” Now, that is simply not true."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "The fact is, either candidate can lose fair and square, without ballot fraud."\n
Donald Trump: "Sure, they can."\n
Donald Trump: "And do you know what?"\n
Savannah Guthrie: "So, will you accept the results of the election?"\n
Donald Trump: "Win or lose, that’s the way I want it to be."\n
Donald Trump: "But when I see thousands of ballots, right?"\n
Donald Trump: "Unsolicited ballots, being given out by the millions, and thousands of them are dumped in dumpsters."\n
Donald Trump: "And when you see ballots with the name Trump, military ballots, from our great military."\n

Audience Member 13: "Mr. Trump, as a frontline ER doctor, working through the coronavirus pandemic-"\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "… I know firsthand, and I’ve seen that many hospitals throughout the United States, are suffering financial hardships."\n
Audience Member 13: "These economic effects are trickling down to the frontline workers."\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "We are being… Across the country, frontline workers are being fired, they’re being furloughed."\n
Audience Member 13: "Our salaries are being cut, and this is also happening another economic sectors as well, including the travel industry and hospitality."\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "My question to you is, how are you going to get the United States back on track, both in terms of the economy and the pandemic?"\n
Donald Trump: "So, it’s happening."\n

Audience Member 13: "Mr. Trump, as a frontline ER doctor, working through the coronavirus pandemic-"\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "… I know firsthand, and I’ve seen that many hospitals throughout the United States, are suffering financial hardships."\n
Audience Member 13: "These economic effects are trickling down to the frontline workers."\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "We are being… Across the country, frontline workers are being fired, they’re being furloughed."\n
Audience Member 13: "Our salaries are being cut, and this is also happening another economic sectors as well, including the travel industry and hospitality."\n
Donald Trump: "Right."\n
Audience Member 13: "My question to you is, how are you going to get the United States back on track, both in terms of the economy and the pandemic?"\n
Donald Trump: "So, it’s happening."\n
Donald Trump: "We just set a record, 11.4 million jobs."\n
Donald Trump: "We are going to have a phenomenal third quarter, which will be announced on November 1st, just prior to the big November 3rd day, where I think you’re going to see a red wave."\n
Donald Trump: "But we’re going to have a tremendous announcement."\n
Donald Trump: "I believe."\n
Donald Trump: "I mean, we’re going to find out, but GDP is going through the roof."\n

Audience Member 14: "Mr. President, my parents are, as you heard, both frontline healthcare workers."\n
Audience Member 14: "And I’ve seen the physical and the mental toll that this pandemic has taken on them, firsthand."\n
Audience Member 14: "As well as the exacerbation of coronavirus, due to Americans who are not wearing masks or participating in social distancing."\n
Audience Member 14: "After contracting COVID-19 yourself, has your opinion changed on the importance of mask wearing?"\n
Donald Trump: "No, because I was okay with the masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I was good with it, but I’ve heard many different stories on masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I had, being president, you have people, they bring meals, they bring this, they… And I had an instance recently, where a very wonderful person is bringing me a meal, and he’s playing with his mask."\n
Donald Trump: "And he’s touching his mask, all over the place."\n

Savannah Guthrie: "Okay, go ahead."\n
Audience Member 14: "Mr. President, my parents are, as you heard, both frontline healthcare workers."\n
Audience Member 14: "And I’ve seen the physical and the mental toll that this pandemic has taken on them, firsthand."\n
Audience Member 14: "As well as the exacerbation of coronavirus, due to Americans who are not wearing masks or participating in social distancing."\n
Audience Member 14: "After contracting COVID-19 yourself, has your opinion changed on the importance of mask wearing?"\n
Donald Trump: "No, because I was okay with the masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I was good with it, but I’ve heard many different stories on masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I had, being president, you have people, they bring meals, they bring this, they… And I had an instance recently, where a very wonderful person is bringing me a meal, and he’s playing with his mask."\n
Donald Trump: "And he’s touching his mask, all over the place."\n
Donald Trump: "And then he’s bringing a plate in, and I’m saying, “Well, I don’t know if that’s so good.” I mean, the good news, I didn’t eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "Okay?"\n

Donald Trump: "Great question."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Let’s talk to Isabella, and put the mic close to your mouth."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Okay, go ahead."\n
Audience Member 14: "Mr. President, my parents are, as you heard, both frontline healthcare workers."\n
Audience Member 14: "And I’ve seen the physical and the mental toll that this pandemic has taken on them, firsthand."\n
Audience Member 14: "As well as the exacerbation of coronavirus, due to Americans who are not wearing masks or participating in social distancing."\n
Audience Member 14: "After contracting COVID-19 yourself, has your opinion changed on the importance of mask wearing?"\n
Donald Trump: "No, because I was okay with the masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I was good with it, but I’ve heard many different stories on masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I had, being president, you have people, they bring meals, they bring this, they… And I had an instance recently, where a very wonderful person is bringing me a meal, and he’s playing with his mask."\n
Donald Trump: "And he’s touching his mask, all over the place."\n
Donald Trump: "And then he’s bringing a plate in, and I’m saying, “Well, I don’t know if that’s so good.” I mean, the good news, I didn’t eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "Okay?"\n
Donald Trump: "I decided not to eat it."\n
 n120528b07p2932 50000 5 incomplete neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 60000 3 not_argumentative neither
Audience Member 14: "Mr. President, my parents are, as you heard, both frontline healthcare workers."\n
Audience Member 14: "And I’ve seen the physical and the mental toll that this pandemic has taken on them, firsthand."\n
Audience Member 14: "As well as the exacerbation of coronavirus, due to Americans who are not wearing masks or participating in social distancing."\n
Audience Member 14: "After contracting COVID-19 yourself, has your opinion changed on the importance of mask wearing?"\n
Donald Trump: "No, because I was okay with the masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I was good with it, but I’ve heard many different stories on masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I had, being president, you have people, they bring meals, they bring this, they… And I had an instance recently, where a very wonderful person is bringing me a meal, and he’s playing with his mask."\n
Donald Trump: "And he’s touching his mask, all over the place."\n
Donald Trump: "And then he’s bringing a plate in, and I’m saying, “Well, I don’t know if that’s so good.” I mean, the good news, I didn’t eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "Okay?"\n
Donald Trump: "I decided not to eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "This was a month ago."\n
Donald Trump: "But I… Look, look, you have, on the masks, you have two stories."\n
Donald Trump: "You have a story where they want, a story where they don’t want."\n
Donald Trump: "I am all for it."\n
 n120532b07p2730 90000 5 incomplete neither 50000 5 even though the second sentence has a 2nd thoughts about wearing face mask they agree that whos not participate wearing mask and social distancing is a big problem. support 80000 4 not_related neither
Audience Member 14: "As well as the exacerbation of coronavirus, due to Americans who are not wearing masks or participating in social distancing."\n
Audience Member 14: "After contracting COVID-19 yourself, has your opinion changed on the importance of mask wearing?"\n
Donald Trump: "No, because I was okay with the masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I was good with it, but I’ve heard many different stories on masks."\n
Donald Trump: "I had, being president, you have people, they bring meals, they bring this, they… And I had an instance recently, where a very wonderful person is bringing me a meal, and he’s playing with his mask."\n
Donald Trump: "And he’s touching his mask, all over the place."\n
Donald Trump: "And then he’s bringing a plate in, and I’m saying, “Well, I don’t know if that’s so good.” I mean, the good news, I didn’t eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "Okay?"\n
Donald Trump: "I decided not to eat it."\n
Donald Trump: "This was a month ago."\n
Donald Trump: "But I… Look, look, you have, on the masks, you have two stories."\n
Donald Trump: "You have a story where they want, a story where they don’t want."\n
Donald Trump: "I am all for it."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Who is, I don’t get that, because it’s just… All of your public health officials, your administration, they’re in unison about this."\n
Donald Trump: "Some."\n

 n120581b07p8084 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Audience Member 15: "Thank you for your service, Mr. President."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Thank you."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you very much."\n
Audience Member 15: "We’re a hard-working middle-class family of four."\n
Audience Member 15: "My husband and I are both self-employed, and we have to get our own individual healthcare."\n
Audience Member 15: "As you know, healthcare costs have gone up considerably over the decades."\n
Audience Member 15: "And you had originally said you were going to repeal and replace Obamacare."\n
Audience Member 15: "What is your plan now in 2020 to make healthcare costs affordable for Americans like myself?"\n
Donald Trump: "Good."\n
Donald Trump: "So we got rid of the individual mandate on Obamacare, which was the worst part of Obamacare, and now you could actually say it’s not Obamacare because that’s how big it was, where you had to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance, so we got rid of that."\n
Donald Trump: "That was a big, big thing."\n
Donald Trump: "And by doing that, and we will always have… By the way, we’re always protecting people with pre-existing conditions, and I can’t say that more strongly, but we’ve been able to bring healthcare costs way down."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I took over Obamacare, got rid of the individual mandate, made it good, managed it much better."\n
Donald Trump: "Remember, they had the $5 billion website disaster, and all of the problems they had."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it’s not good."\n
 n130016b07p1623 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 4 not_argumentative neither
Audience Member 15: "We’re a hard-working middle-class family of four."\n
Audience Member 15: "My husband and I are both self-employed, and we have to get our own individual healthcare."\n
Audience Member 15: "As you know, healthcare costs have gone up considerably over the decades."\n
Audience Member 15: "And you had originally said you were going to repeal and replace Obamacare."\n
Audience Member 15: "What is your plan now in 2020 to make healthcare costs affordable for Americans like myself?"\n
Donald Trump: "Good."\n
Donald Trump: "So we got rid of the individual mandate on Obamacare, which was the worst part of Obamacare, and now you could actually say it’s not Obamacare because that’s how big it was, where you had to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance, so we got rid of that."\n
Donald Trump: "That was a big, big thing."\n
Donald Trump: "And by doing that, and we will always have… By the way, we’re always protecting people with pre-existing conditions, and I can’t say that more strongly, but we’ve been able to bring healthcare costs way down."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I took over Obamacare, got rid of the individual mandate, made it good, managed it much better."\n
Donald Trump: "Remember, they had the $5 billion website disaster, and all of the problems they had."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it’s not good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’d like to terminate it, and we want a much less expensive healthcare that’s a much better healthcare, and that’s where we’re aiming."\n
Donald Trump: "And if we can do that, and we have a very good chance of doing it, but we’ve also brought down the price of Obamacare."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it basically is never going to be great, and I want to give great healthcare."\n

Audience Member 15: "My husband and I are both self-employed, and we have to get our own individual healthcare."\n
Audience Member 15: "As you know, healthcare costs have gone up considerably over the decades."\n
Audience Member 15: "And you had originally said you were going to repeal and replace Obamacare."\n
Audience Member 15: "What is your plan now in 2020 to make healthcare costs affordable for Americans like myself?"\n
Donald Trump: "Good."\n
Donald Trump: "So we got rid of the individual mandate on Obamacare, which was the worst part of Obamacare, and now you could actually say it’s not Obamacare because that’s how big it was, where you had to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance, so we got rid of that."\n
Donald Trump: "That was a big, big thing."\n
Donald Trump: "And by doing that, and we will always have… By the way, we’re always protecting people with pre-existing conditions, and I can’t say that more strongly, but we’ve been able to bring healthcare costs way down."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I took over Obamacare, got rid of the individual mandate, made it good, managed it much better."\n
Donald Trump: "Remember, they had the $5 billion website disaster, and all of the problems they had."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it’s not good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’d like to terminate it, and we want a much less expensive healthcare that’s a much better healthcare, and that’s where we’re aiming."\n
Donald Trump: "And if we can do that, and we have a very good chance of doing it, but we’ve also brought down the price of Obamacare."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it basically is never going to be great, and I want to give great healthcare."\n
Donald Trump: "So important."\n
 n130020b07p2122 40000 5 Both sentences show an attack. attack 80000 4 Trump's statement is about the failure of Obamacare support 20000 5 Statement 2 attacks Statement 1 "Obamacare" attack
Audience Member 15: "As you know, healthcare costs have gone up considerably over the decades."\n
Audience Member 15: "And you had originally said you were going to repeal and replace Obamacare."\n
Audience Member 15: "What is your plan now in 2020 to make healthcare costs affordable for Americans like myself?"\n
Donald Trump: "Good."\n
Donald Trump: "So we got rid of the individual mandate on Obamacare, which was the worst part of Obamacare, and now you could actually say it’s not Obamacare because that’s how big it was, where you had to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance, so we got rid of that."\n
Donald Trump: "That was a big, big thing."\n
Donald Trump: "And by doing that, and we will always have… By the way, we’re always protecting people with pre-existing conditions, and I can’t say that more strongly, but we’ve been able to bring healthcare costs way down."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I took over Obamacare, got rid of the individual mandate, made it good, managed it much better."\n
Donald Trump: "Remember, they had the $5 billion website disaster, and all of the problems they had."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it’s not good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’d like to terminate it, and we want a much less expensive healthcare that’s a much better healthcare, and that’s where we’re aiming."\n
Donald Trump: "And if we can do that, and we have a very good chance of doing it, but we’ve also brought down the price of Obamacare."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it basically is never going to be great, and I want to give great healthcare."\n
Donald Trump: "So important."\n
Donald Trump: "And thank you very much."\n
 n130021b07p2223 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 80000 4 Both statements provide details regarding the problem of Obamacare support 40000 5 For me, it should be "attack," because this is a valid argument showing that Obamacare is the problem in America. attack
Audience Member 15: "And you had originally said you were going to repeal and replace Obamacare."\n
Audience Member 15: "What is your plan now in 2020 to make healthcare costs affordable for Americans like myself?"\n
Donald Trump: "Good."\n
Donald Trump: "So we got rid of the individual mandate on Obamacare, which was the worst part of Obamacare, and now you could actually say it’s not Obamacare because that’s how big it was, where you had to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance, so we got rid of that."\n
Donald Trump: "That was a big, big thing."\n
Donald Trump: "And by doing that, and we will always have… By the way, we’re always protecting people with pre-existing conditions, and I can’t say that more strongly, but we’ve been able to bring healthcare costs way down."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I took over Obamacare, got rid of the individual mandate, made it good, managed it much better."\n
Donald Trump: "Remember, they had the $5 billion website disaster, and all of the problems they had."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it’s not good."\n
Donald Trump: "We’d like to terminate it, and we want a much less expensive healthcare that’s a much better healthcare, and that’s where we’re aiming."\n
Donald Trump: "And if we can do that, and we have a very good chance of doing it, but we’ve also brought down the price of Obamacare."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem with Obamacare, it basically is never going to be great, and I want to give great healthcare."\n
Donald Trump: "So important."\n
Donald Trump: "And thank you very much."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Mr. President, I got a follow-up pre-existing conditions."\n

Savannah Guthrie: "Why not use your office to make the second stimulus payment a separate targeted emergency relief package to help Americans weather the pandemic?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, we’ve actually passed three packages, and we’re on our fourth, and I agree with him 100%."\n
Donald Trump: "He should vote for me."\n
 n130064b07p6270 60000 3 not_related neither 80000 4 not_related neither 40000 5 For me, this is "support," because Trump is showing that he agrees with the first sentence. support
Savannah Guthrie: "But if you’re successful in court-"\n
Donald Trump: "And here’s the thing-"\n
Savannah Guthrie: "… in November, those preexisting conditions, that promise will be gone."\n
Donald Trump: "If we don’t succeed, we are running the remnants of whatever’s left because we took it apart."\n
Donald Trump: "We are running the remnants of whatever’s left much better than the previous administration, which ran it very badly, but we’d like to have new healthcare much better and much less expensive."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Let me get to question number five."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "And you’ll like this, he’s stuck in traffic."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "His name is Joe White."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "He is registered as a Democrat."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "He says he’s leaning toward Biden and voted for Hillary Clinton in 2016."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "And his question was a, a second stimulus payment has been broadly agreed upon by the Republicans and Democrats, and yet, now we’re in October and it’s still not passed."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Why not use your office to make the second stimulus payment a separate targeted emergency relief package to help Americans weather the pandemic?"\n
Donald Trump: "Well, we’ve actually passed three packages, and we’re on our fourth, and I agree with him 100%."\n
Donald Trump: "He should vote for me."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem you have is Nancy Pelosi."\n

Donald Trump: "He should vote for me."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem you have is Nancy Pelosi."\n

Donald Trump: "And we should have a stimulus, and I want a stimulus."\n
Donald Trump: "The Republicans will approve a stimulus."\n
Donald Trump: "The problem is she doesn’t want to do it because she thinks it’s bad for her election."\n
Donald Trump: "The fact is, she’s wrong because people know she’s in our way, she’s not approving it, she doesn’t appreciate our people, and she doesn’t appreciate, at all, our workers."\n
Donald Trump: "Nancy Pelosi, we are ready to sign and pass stimulus, but she’s got to approve it."\n

Donald Trump: "That’s right."\n

Donald Trump: "I think, talking about president Obama having to do with somebody else, that the president is put there for four years, not for three years."\n
Donald Trump: "So during this fourth year, it happened to come up, unfortunately, because I had great respect for Justice Ginsburg."\n
Donald Trump: "But a vacancy happened to come up, and we picked somebody that’s outstanding."\n
Donald Trump: "She has been an absolute star, and I’m extremely proud of it."\n
Donald Trump: "But again, plenty of time."\n
Donald Trump: "There’s plenty of time."\n
Donald Trump: "We’re going to do it before the election, but we also have much time after the election."\n
Donald Trump: "But there’s no reason to wait, because it’s almost unanimous, it seems to me, certainly within the Republican party."\n
Donald Trump: "And frankly, most of the Democrats within closed rooms, I guarantee you that."\n

Donald Trump: "Well, I think she’ll have to make that decision."\n
Donald Trump: "I don’t think she has any conflict at all."\n
Donald Trump: "A Supreme Court judge does not have… They can make their own decision."\n
Donald Trump: "They actually have additional power to make that decision."\n
Donald Trump: "It would be totally up to her."\n
Donald Trump: "I would think that she would be able to rule either for me or against me, being I don’t see any conflict whatsoever."\n

Savannah Guthrie: "So in fact, the DACA program has been curtailed by your administration."\n
Donald Trump: "Well, what happens is because of the pandemic, much changed on the immigration front."\n
Donald Trump: "Mexico is heavily infected, as you know."\n

Audience Member 16: "Thank you, Mr. President."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Thank you."\n
Donald Trump: "Thank you very much."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Mr. President, in point of fact, the DACA program… Under your administration, no new applicants are allowed."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "And in fact, the DACA recipients now have to renew every year as opposed to every two years."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "So in fact, the DACA program has been curtailed by your administration."\n
Donald Trump: "Well, what happens is because of the pandemic, much changed on the immigration front."\n
Donald Trump: "Mexico is heavily infected, as you know."\n
Donald Trump: "And we’ve made it very, very difficult to come in because of the pandemic, and other reasons, and crime."\n
Donald Trump: "But we have a very strong border right now, and we have to keep it that way."\n
Donald Trump: "But we want people to come into our country, but they have to come in through a merit system, and they have to come in legally."\n
Donald Trump: "And people are very, very happy with it."\n
Donald Trump: "You haven’t heard any complaints about that."\n
Donald Trump: "But what happened is because of the pandemic, we have to be extra cautious."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "You have been promising this immigration bill since, well, at least July, when you told my colleague on Telemundo it was coming."\n

Donald Trump: "And people are very, very happy with it."\n
Donald Trump: "You haven’t heard any complaints about that."\n
Donald Trump: "But what happened is because of the pandemic, we have to be extra cautious."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "You have been promising this immigration bill since, well, at least July, when you told my colleague on Telemundo it was coming."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "But nothing’s come yet."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s very happy."\n
Donald Trump: "The fact is, we got rid of catch and release, which is a disaster."\n
Donald Trump: "You catch somebody."\n
Donald Trump: "They could be a murderer."\n
Donald Trump: "That could be a rapist, and we’re supposed to release them into our country."\n
Donald Trump: "These are the laws that I inherited."\n
Donald Trump: "We ended that program."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I think you’re going to see something very, very good."\n
Donald Trump: "The whole immigration… If you look at what’s going on, people used to pour into our country."\n
Donald Trump: "And especially during the pandemic, I think even you, Savannah, will be very impressed with what we’ve done."\n

Savannah Guthrie: "But nothing’s come yet."\n
Donald Trump: "It’s very happy."\n
Donald Trump: "The fact is, we got rid of catch and release, which is a disaster."\n
Donald Trump: "You catch somebody."\n
Donald Trump: "They could be a murderer."\n
Donald Trump: "That could be a rapist, and we’re supposed to release them into our country."\n
Donald Trump: "These are the laws that I inherited."\n
Donald Trump: "We ended that program."\n
Donald Trump: "Now, I think you’re going to see something very, very good."\n
Donald Trump: "The whole immigration… If you look at what’s going on, people used to pour into our country."\n
Donald Trump: "And especially during the pandemic, I think even you, Savannah, will be very impressed with what we’ve done."\n
Savannah Guthrie: "Sir, we have about 30 seconds left."\n

Susan Page: "Senator Harris, the coronavirus is not under control."\n
Susan Page: "Over the past week, Johns Hopkins reports that 39 states have had more COVID cases over the past seven days than in the week before."\n
Susan Page: "Nine States have set new records."\n
Susan Page: "Even if a vaccine is released soon, the next administration will face hard choices."\n
Susan Page: "What would a Biden administration do in January and February that a Trump administration wouldn’t do?"\n
Susan Page: "Would you impose new lockdowns for businesses and schools and hotspots, a federal mandate to wear masks?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes to respond without interruption."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n

Kamala Harris: "210,000 dead people in our country in just the last several months."\n

Susan Page: "Would you impose new lockdowns for businesses and schools and hotspots, a federal mandate to wear masks?"\n

Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Kamala Harris: "Well, the American people have witnessed what is the greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country."\n
Kamala Harris: "And here are the facts."\n
Kamala Harris: "210,000 dead people in our country in just the last several months."\n
Kamala Harris: "Over 7 million people who have contracted this disease."\n
Kamala Harris: "One in five businesses closed."\n
Kamala Harris: "We’re looking at frontline workers who have been treated like sacrificial workers."\n
Kamala Harris: "We are looking at over 30 million people, who in the last several months, had to file for unemployment."\n
Kamala Harris: "And here’s the thing, on January 28th, the vice president and the president were informed about the nature of this pandemic."\n
Kamala Harris: "They were informed that it’s lethal in consequence, that it is airborne, that it will affect young people, and that it would be contracted because it is airborne."\n

Kamala Harris: "210,000 dead people in our country in just the last several months."\n
Kamala Harris: "Over 7 million people who have contracted this disease."\n
Kamala Harris: "One in five businesses closed."\n
Kamala Harris: "We’re looking at frontline workers who have been treated like sacrificial workers."\n
Kamala Harris: "We are looking at over 30 million people, who in the last several months, had to file for unemployment."\n
Kamala Harris: "And here’s the thing, on January 28th, the vice president and the president were informed about the nature of this pandemic."\n
Kamala Harris: "They were informed that it’s lethal in consequence, that it is airborne, that it will affect young people, and that it would be contracted because it is airborne."\n
Kamala Harris: "And they knew what was happening, and they didn’t tell you."\n
Kamala Harris: "Can you imagine if you knew on January 28th, as opposed to March 13th, what they knew, what you might’ve done to prepare?"\n
Kamala Harris: "They knew, and they covered it up."\n
Kamala Harris: "The president said it was a hoax."\n
Kamala Harris: "They minimized the seriousness of it."\n
Kamala Harris: "The president said, “You’re on one side of his ledger if you wear a mask."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re on the other side of his ledger if you don’t.” And in spite of all of that, today, they still don’t have a plan."\n
Kamala Harris: "They still don’t have a plan."\n

Kamala Harris: "Well, Joe Biden does."\n
Kamala Harris: "And our plan is about what we need to do around a national strategy for contact tracing, for testing, for administration of the vaccine, and making sure that it will be free for all."\n

Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris-"\n
Kamala Harris: "… right to reelection based on this."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, more than 210,000 Americans have died of COVID-19 since February."\n
Susan Page: "The US death toll, as a percentage of our population, is higher than that of almost every other wealthy nation on Earth."\n
Susan Page: "For instance, our death rate is two and a half times that of Canada, next door."\n
Susan Page: "You had the administration’s coronavirus task force."\n
Susan Page: "Why is the US death toll, as a percentage of our population, higher than that of almost every other wealthy country?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes to respond without interruption."\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, thank you."\n
Mike Pence: "And I want to thank the Commission and the University of Utah for hosting this event."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator Harris, it’s a privilege to be on the stage with you."\n
Mike Pence: "And our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year."\n
Mike Pence: "But I want the American people to know that from the very first day, President Donald Trump has put the health of America first."\n
Mike Pence: "Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done."\n
 n150052b07p5456 90000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 1 not_related neither
Susan Page: "The US death toll, as a percentage of our population, is higher than that of almost every other wealthy nation on Earth."\n
Susan Page: "For instance, our death rate is two and a half times that of Canada, next door."\n
Susan Page: "You had the administration’s coronavirus task force."\n
Susan Page: "Why is the US death toll, as a percentage of our population, higher than that of almost every other wealthy country?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes to respond without interruption."\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, thank you."\n
Mike Pence: "And I want to thank the Commission and the University of Utah for hosting this event."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator Harris, it’s a privilege to be on the stage with you."\n
Mike Pence: "And our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year."\n
Mike Pence: "But I want the American people to know that from the very first day, President Donald Trump has put the health of America first."\n
Mike Pence: "Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done."\n
Mike Pence: "And that was, he suspended all travel from China, the second largest economy in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "Now, Senator Joe Biden opposed that decision."\n
Mike Pence: "He said it was xenophobic and hysterical."\n
Mike Pence: "But I can tell you having led the white house coronavirus task force that that decision alone by President Trump bought us invaluable time to stand up the greatest national mobilization since World War Two."\n

Susan Page: "And you have two minutes to respond without interruption."\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, thank you."\n
Mike Pence: "And I want to thank the Commission and the University of Utah for hosting this event."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator Harris, it’s a privilege to be on the stage with you."\n
Mike Pence: "And our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year."\n
Mike Pence: "But I want the American people to know that from the very first day, President Donald Trump has put the health of America first."\n
Mike Pence: "Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done."\n
Mike Pence: "And that was, he suspended all travel from China, the second largest economy in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "Now, Senator Joe Biden opposed that decision."\n
Mike Pence: "He said it was xenophobic and hysterical."\n
Mike Pence: "But I can tell you having led the white house coronavirus task force that that decision alone by President Trump bought us invaluable time to stand up the greatest national mobilization since World War Two."\n
Mike Pence: "And I believe it saved hundreds of thousands of American lives."\n
Mike Pence: "Because with that time, we were able to reinvent testing."\n
Mike Pence: "More than 115 million tests had been done to date."\n
Mike Pence: "We were able to see to the delivery of billions of supplies, so our doctors and nurses had the resources support they needed."\n

Mike Pence: "And I want to thank the Commission and the University of Utah for hosting this event."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator Harris, it’s a privilege to be on the stage with you."\n
Mike Pence: "And our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year."\n
Mike Pence: "But I want the American people to know that from the very first day, President Donald Trump has put the health of America first."\n
Mike Pence: "Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done."\n
Mike Pence: "And that was, he suspended all travel from China, the second largest economy in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "Now, Senator Joe Biden opposed that decision."\n
Mike Pence: "He said it was xenophobic and hysterical."\n
Mike Pence: "But I can tell you having led the white house coronavirus task force that that decision alone by President Trump bought us invaluable time to stand up the greatest national mobilization since World War Two."\n
Mike Pence: "And I believe it saved hundreds of thousands of American lives."\n
Mike Pence: "Because with that time, we were able to reinvent testing."\n
Mike Pence: "More than 115 million tests had been done to date."\n
Mike Pence: "We were able to see to the delivery of billions of supplies, so our doctors and nurses had the resources support they needed."\n
Mike Pence: "And we began, really, before the month of February we started to develop a vaccine and to develop medicines and therapeutics that have been saving lives all along the way."\n
Mike Pence: "And under President Trump’s leadership, Operation Warp Speed, we believe we’ll have literally tens of millions of doses of a vaccine before the end of this year."\n

Mike Pence: "And we began, really, before the month of February we started to develop a vaccine and to develop medicines and therapeutics that have been saving lives all along the way."\n
Mike Pence: "And under President Trump’s leadership, Operation Warp Speed, we believe we’ll have literally tens of millions of doses of a vaccine before the end of this year."\n
Mike Pence: "The reality is, when you look at the Biden plan, it reads an awful lot like what President Trump, and I, and our task force has been doing every step of the way."\n
Mike Pence: "And quite frankly, when I look at their plan that talks about advancing testing, creating new PPE, developing a vaccine, it looks a little bit like plagiarism, which is something Joe Biden knows a little bit about."\n

Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President Pence-"\n
Mike Pence: "… of America first."\n

Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, you have one minute to respond."\n
Mike Pence: "There’s not a day gone by that I haven’t thought of every American family that’s lost a loved one."\n
Mike Pence: "And I want all of you to know that you’ll always be in our hearts and in our prayers."\n
Mike Pence: "But when you say what the American people have done over these last eight months, hasn’t worked, that’s a great disservice to the sacrifices the American people have made-"\n
Kamala Harris: "I’m referring to the president-"\n
Mike Pence: "But the reality… If I may finish, Senator."\n

Mike Pence: "President Trump and I have great confidence in the American people and their ability to take that information and put it into practice."\n
Mike Pence: "In the height of the epidemic when we were losing a heartbreaking number of 2,500 Americans a day, we surged resources to New Jersey and New York and New Orleans and Detroit."\n
Mike Pence: "We told the American people what needed to be done, and the American people made the sacrifices."\n
Mike Pence: "When the outbreak in the Sun Belt happened this summer, again, Americans stepped forward."\n
Mike Pence: "But the reality is the work of the President of the United States goes on."\n
Mike Pence: "A vacancy on the Supreme Court of the United States has come upon us, and the President introduced Judge Amy Coney Barrett."\n
Susan Page: "Yes, thank you."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President."\n
Mike Pence: "If I may say, that Rose Garden event, been a great deal of speculation about it."\n
Mike Pence: "My wife, Karen and I were there and honored to be there."\n
Mike Pence: "Many of the people who were at that event, Susan, actually were tested for Coronavirus, and it was an outdoor event, which all of our scientists regularly and routinely advise."\n
Mike Pence: "The difference here is President Trump and I trust the American people to make choices in the best interest of their health."\n

Kamala Harris: "The American people have had to sacrifice far too much because of the incompetence of this administration."\n
Kamala Harris: "It is asking too much of the people-"\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, we talked about this."\n
Kamala Harris: "It is asking too much of the people."\n
Kamala Harris: "That they would not be equipped with the information they need to help themselves to protect their parents and their children."\n
Susan Page: "I’m sorry."\n
Susan Page: "Kamala Harris, Senator Harris, I mean, I’m sorry."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s fine, I’m Kamala."\n
Susan Page: "No, no, you’re Senator Harris to me."\n
Susan Page: "For life to get back to normal, Dr. Anthony Fauci and other experts say that most of the people who can be vaccinated need to be vaccinated."\n
Susan Page: "But half of Americans now say they wouldn’t take a vaccine if it was released now."\n
Susan Page: "If the Trump administration approves a vaccine before or after the election, should Americans take it, and would you take it?"\n

Mike Pence: "Well, thank you, but I would like to go back because the reality is that we’re going to have a vaccine, Senator, in record time."\n

Mike Pence: "And we’re right now producing tens of millions of doses."\n
Mike Pence: "So the fact that you continue to undermine public confidence in a vaccine, if the vaccine emerges during the Trump administration, I think is unconscionable."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator, I just ask you, stop playing politics with people’s lives."\n
Mike Pence: "The reality is that we will have a vaccine, we believe, before the end of this year."\n
Mike Pence: "And it will have the capacity to save countless American lives."\n
Mike Pence: "And your continuous undermining of confidence in a vaccine is just, it’s unacceptable."\n
Mike Pence: "And let me also say, the reality is, when you talk about failure in this administration, we actually do know what failure looks like in a pandemic."\n
Mike Pence: "It was 2009."\n
Mike Pence: "The Swine flu arrived in the United States."\n
Mike Pence: "Thankfully, it ended up not being as lethal as the Coronavirus."\n
Mike Pence: "But before the end of the year, when Joe Biden was Vice President of the United States, not seven and a half million people contracted the Swine flu, 60 million Americans contracted the Swine flu."\n
Mike Pence: "If the Swine flu had been as lethal as the Coronavirus in 2009 when Joe Biden was Vice President, we would have lost 2 million American lives."\n

Kamala Harris: "Let me tell you first of all, the day I got the call from Joe Biden, it was actually a Zoom call, asking me to serve with him on this ticket was probably one of the most memorable days of my life."\n
Kamala Harris: "I thought about my mother, who came to the United States at the age of 19, gave birth to me at the age of 25 at Kaiser Hospital in Oakland, California."\n
Kamala Harris: "And the thought that I’d be sitting here right now, I know, would make her proud."\n
Kamala Harris: "And she must be looking down on this."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe and I were raised in a very similar way."\n
Kamala Harris: "We were raised with values that are about hard work, about the value and the dignity of public service, and about the importance of fighting for the dignity of all people."\n
Kamala Harris: "And I think Joe asked me to serve with him because I have a career that included being elected the first woman District Attorney of San Francisco, where I created models of innovation for law enforcement, in terms of reform of the criminal justice system."\n
Kamala Harris: "I was elected the first woman of color, and black woman to be elected Attorney General of the state of California, where I ran the second largest department of justice in the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "Second only to the United States Department of Justice."\n
Kamala Harris: "And there, I took on everything from transnational criminal organizations, to the big banks that were taking advantage of homeowners, to for-profit colleges that were taking advantage of veterans."\n
Kamala Harris: "And then of course, now I serve in the United States Senate as only the second black woman ever elected to the United States Senate."\n

Kamala Harris: "Second only to the United States Department of Justice."\n
Kamala Harris: "And there, I took on everything from transnational criminal organizations, to the big banks that were taking advantage of homeowners, to for-profit colleges that were taking advantage of veterans."\n
Kamala Harris: "And then of course, now I serve in the United States Senate as only the second black woman ever elected to the United States Senate."\n
Kamala Harris: "I serve on the Senate Intelligence Committee where I’ve been in regular receipt of classified information about threats to our nation in hotspots around the world."\n
Kamala Harris: "I’ve traveled the world, I’ve met with our soldiers in war zones."\n
Kamala Harris: "And I think Joe has asked me to serve with him because he knows that we share a purpose, which is about lifting up the American people."\n
Kamala Harris: "And after the four years that we have seen of Donald Trump unifying our country around our common values and principles."\n

Mike Pence: "But I’m just extremely grateful and was more than a little moved by the broad and bipartisan support."\n
Mike Pence: "And Senator, I want to thank you and Joe Biden for your expressions and genuine concern."\n
Mike Pence: "And I also want to congratulate you, as I did on that phone call, on the historic nature of your nomination."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n
Mike Pence: "I never expected to be on this stage four years ago, so I know the feeling, but the reality is we’ve got an election before the American people in the midst of this challenging year and the stakes have never been higher, but I think the choice has never been here."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President."\n
Susan Page: "I want to give Senator Harris a chance to respond to the same question I asked, which is, do voters have a right to know more detailed health information about presidential candidates and especially about presidents, especially when they’re facing some kind of challenge?"\n
Kamala Harris: "Absolutely."\n
Kamala Harris: "And that’s why Joe Biden has been so incredibly transparent."\n
Kamala Harris: "And certainly by contrast that the President has not, both in terms of health records, but also let’s look at taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know because of great investigative journalism that Donald Trump paid $750 in taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "When I first heard about it, I literally said, “You mean $750,000?” And it was like no, $750."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know Donald Trump owes and is in debt for $400 million."\n
Kamala Harris: "And just so everyone is clear, when we say in debt, it means you owe money to somebody."\n
Kamala Harris: "And it’d be really good to know who the President of the United States, the commander-in-chief owes money to because the American people have a right to know what is influencing the President’s decisions."\n
 n150234b07p3136 50000 5 not_related neither 80000 4 not_related neither 60000 3 not_related neither
Mike Pence: "And I also want to congratulate you, as I did on that phone call, on the historic nature of your nomination."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n
Mike Pence: "I never expected to be on this stage four years ago, so I know the feeling, but the reality is we’ve got an election before the American people in the midst of this challenging year and the stakes have never been higher, but I think the choice has never been here."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President."\n
Susan Page: "I want to give Senator Harris a chance to respond to the same question I asked, which is, do voters have a right to know more detailed health information about presidential candidates and especially about presidents, especially when they’re facing some kind of challenge?"\n
Kamala Harris: "Absolutely."\n
Kamala Harris: "And that’s why Joe Biden has been so incredibly transparent."\n
Kamala Harris: "And certainly by contrast that the President has not, both in terms of health records, but also let’s look at taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know because of great investigative journalism that Donald Trump paid $750 in taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "When I first heard about it, I literally said, “You mean $750,000?” And it was like no, $750."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know Donald Trump owes and is in debt for $400 million."\n
Kamala Harris: "And just so everyone is clear, when we say in debt, it means you owe money to somebody."\n
Kamala Harris: "And it’d be really good to know who the President of the United States, the commander-in-chief owes money to because the American people have a right to know what is influencing the President’s decisions."\n
Kamala Harris: "And is he making those decisions on the best interest of the American people, of you or self-interest?"\n
Kamala Harris: "So, Susan, I’m glad you asked about transparency because it has to be across the board."\n

Susan Page: "I want to give Senator Harris a chance to respond to the same question I asked, which is, do voters have a right to know more detailed health information about presidential candidates and especially about presidents, especially when they’re facing some kind of challenge?"\n
Kamala Harris: "Absolutely."\n
Kamala Harris: "And that’s why Joe Biden has been so incredibly transparent."\n
Kamala Harris: "And certainly by contrast that the President has not, both in terms of health records, but also let’s look at taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know because of great investigative journalism that Donald Trump paid $750 in taxes."\n
Kamala Harris: "When I first heard about it, I literally said, “You mean $750,000?” And it was like no, $750."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know Donald Trump owes and is in debt for $400 million."\n
Kamala Harris: "And just so everyone is clear, when we say in debt, it means you owe money to somebody."\n
Kamala Harris: "And it’d be really good to know who the President of the United States, the commander-in-chief owes money to because the American people have a right to know what is influencing the President’s decisions."\n
Kamala Harris: "And is he making those decisions on the best interest of the American people, of you or self-interest?"\n
Kamala Harris: "So, Susan, I’m glad you asked about transparency because it has to be across the board."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe has been incredibly transparent over many, many years."\n
Kamala Harris: "The one thing we all know about Joe, he puts it all out there."\n
Kamala Harris: "He is honest, he is forthright, but Donald Trump on the other hand has been about covering up everything."\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, Susan-"\n

Kamala Harris: "When I first heard about it, I literally said, “You mean $750,000?” And it was like no, $750."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now know Donald Trump owes and is in debt for $400 million."\n
Kamala Harris: "And just so everyone is clear, when we say in debt, it means you owe money to somebody."\n
Kamala Harris: "And it’d be really good to know who the President of the United States, the commander-in-chief owes money to because the American people have a right to know what is influencing the President’s decisions."\n
Kamala Harris: "And is he making those decisions on the best interest of the American people, of you or self-interest?"\n
Kamala Harris: "So, Susan, I’m glad you asked about transparency because it has to be across the board."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe has been incredibly transparent over many, many years."\n
Kamala Harris: "The one thing we all know about Joe, he puts it all out there."\n
Kamala Harris: "He is honest, he is forthright, but Donald Trump on the other hand has been about covering up everything."\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, Susan-"\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris."\n
Susan Page: "I want to give you a chance to respond, Vice President."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, look, I respect the fact that Joe Biden spent 47 years in public life."\n

Kamala Harris: "That’s a great segue."\n
Susan Page: "… which is about the economy."\n
Susan Page: "This has been another aspect of life for Americans, it’s been so affected by this coronavirus."\n
Susan Page: "We have a jobs crisis brewing."\n
Susan Page: "On Friday, we learned that the unemployment rate had declined to seven point nine percent in September, but the job growth had stalled."\n
Susan Page: "And that was before the latest round of layoffs and furloughs in the airline industry, at Disney, and elsewhere."\n
Susan Page: "Hundreds of thousands of discouraged workers have stopped looking for work."\n
Susan Page: "Nearly 11 million jobs that existed at the beginning of the year haven’t been replaced."\n
Susan Page: "Those hardest hit include Latinos, Blacks, and women."\n
