 n150269b07p6567 60000 3 None of the sentences are providing an argument, they simply present observations. support 80000 4 Harris' statement is an attack regarding the sudden change of topic attack 50000 5 not_related neither
Susan Page: "Would raising taxes put the recovery at risk?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes to answer uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the issue of the economy, I think there couldn’t be a more fundamental difference between Donald Trump and Joe Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden believes you measure the health and the strength of America’s economy based on the health and the strength of the American worker and the American family."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the other hand, you have Donald Trump who measures the strength of the economy based on how rich people are doing, which is why he passed a tax bill benefiting the top one percent and the biggest corporations of America, leading to a two trillion dollar deficit that the American people are going to have to pay for."\n
Kamala Harris: "On day one, Joe Biden will repeal that tax bill, he’ll get rid of it."\n
Kamala Harris: "And what he’ll do with the money is invest it in the American people."\n
Kamala Harris: "And through a plan that is about investing in infrastructure, something that Donald Trump said he would do, I remember hearing about some infrastructure week, I don’t think it ever happened, but Joe Biden will do that."\n
Kamala Harris: "He’ll invest in infrastructure."\n
Kamala Harris: "It’s about upgrading our roads and bridges, but also investing in clean energy and renewable energy."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe was going to invest that money in what we need to do around innovation."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a time when our country believed in science and invested in research and development, so that we were an innovation leader on the globe."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden will use that money to invest in education."\n
Kamala Harris: "So for example, for folks who want to go to a two-year community college, it will be free."\n
 n150286b07p8588 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 hese sentences are clearly supporting each other and you would only know this from the context. support 90000 5 not_related neither
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden believes you measure the health and the strength of America’s economy based on the health and the strength of the American worker and the American family."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the other hand, you have Donald Trump who measures the strength of the economy based on how rich people are doing, which is why he passed a tax bill benefiting the top one percent and the biggest corporations of America, leading to a two trillion dollar deficit that the American people are going to have to pay for."\n
Kamala Harris: "On day one, Joe Biden will repeal that tax bill, he’ll get rid of it."\n
Kamala Harris: "And what he’ll do with the money is invest it in the American people."\n
Kamala Harris: "And through a plan that is about investing in infrastructure, something that Donald Trump said he would do, I remember hearing about some infrastructure week, I don’t think it ever happened, but Joe Biden will do that."\n
Kamala Harris: "He’ll invest in infrastructure."\n
Kamala Harris: "It’s about upgrading our roads and bridges, but also investing in clean energy and renewable energy."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe was going to invest that money in what we need to do around innovation."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a time when our country believed in science and invested in research and development, so that we were an innovation leader on the globe."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden will use that money to invest in education."\n
Kamala Harris: "So for example, for folks who want to go to a two-year community college, it will be free."\n
Kamala Harris: "If you come from a family that makes less than $125,000, you’ll go to a public university for free."\n
Kamala Harris: "And across the board, we’ll make sure that if you have student loan debt, it’s cut by $10,000."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s how Joe Biden thinks about the economy which is, it’s about investing in the people of our country."\n
Kamala Harris: "As opposed to passing a tax bill, which had the benefit of letting American corporations go off-shore to do their business."\n

Kamala Harris: "And what he’ll do with the money is invest it in the American people."\n
Kamala Harris: "And through a plan that is about investing in infrastructure, something that Donald Trump said he would do, I remember hearing about some infrastructure week, I don’t think it ever happened, but Joe Biden will do that."\n
Kamala Harris: "He’ll invest in infrastructure."\n
Kamala Harris: "It’s about upgrading our roads and bridges, but also investing in clean energy and renewable energy."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe was going to invest that money in what we need to do around innovation."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a time when our country believed in science and invested in research and development, so that we were an innovation leader on the globe."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden will use that money to invest in education."\n
Kamala Harris: "So for example, for folks who want to go to a two-year community college, it will be free."\n
Kamala Harris: "If you come from a family that makes less than $125,000, you’ll go to a public university for free."\n
Kamala Harris: "And across the board, we’ll make sure that if you have student loan debt, it’s cut by $10,000."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s how Joe Biden thinks about the economy which is, it’s about investing in the people of our country."\n
Kamala Harris: "As opposed to passing a tax bill, which had the benefit of letting American corporations go off-shore to do their business."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re welcome."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your administration has been predicting a rapid and robust recovery, but the latest economic report suggests that’s not happening."\n

Kamala Harris: "There was a time when our country believed in science and invested in research and development, so that we were an innovation leader on the globe."\n

Kamala Harris: "If you come from a family that makes less than $125,000, you’ll go to a public university for free."\n
Kamala Harris: "And across the board, we’ll make sure that if you have student loan debt, it’s cut by $10,000."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s how Joe Biden thinks about the economy which is, it’s about investing in the people of our country."\n
Kamala Harris: "As opposed to passing a tax bill, which had the benefit of letting American corporations go off-shore to do their business."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re welcome."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your administration has been predicting a rapid and robust recovery, but the latest economic report suggests that’s not happening."\n
Susan Page: "Should Americans be braced for an economic comeback that is going to take not months, but a year or more?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes to answer uninterrupted."\n
Mike Pence: "When President Trump and I took office, America had gone through the slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression."\n
Mike Pence: "It was when Joe Biden was vice president, they tried to tax and spend, and regulate, and bail our way back to a growing economy."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump cut taxes across the board."\n

Kamala Harris: "As opposed to passing a tax bill, which had the benefit of letting American corporations go off-shore to do their business."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re welcome."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your administration has been predicting a rapid and robust recovery, but the latest economic report suggests that’s not happening."\n
Susan Page: "Should Americans be braced for an economic comeback that is going to take not months, but a year or more?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes to answer uninterrupted."\n
Mike Pence: "When President Trump and I took office, America had gone through the slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression."\n
Mike Pence: "It was when Joe Biden was vice president, they tried to tax and spend, and regulate, and bail our way back to a growing economy."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump cut taxes across the board."\n
Mike Pence: "Despite what Senator Harris says, the average American family of four had $2,000 in savings in taxes."\n
Mike Pence: "And with the rise in wages that occurred, most predominantly for blue collar, hardworking Americans, the average household income for a family of four increased by $4,000 following President Trump’s tax cuts."\n

Kamala Harris: "If you come from a family that makes less than $125,000, you’ll go to a public university for free."\n
Kamala Harris: "And across the board, we’ll make sure that if you have student loan debt, it’s cut by $10,000."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s how Joe Biden thinks about the economy which is, it’s about investing in the people of our country."\n
Kamala Harris: "As opposed to passing a tax bill, which had the benefit of letting American corporations go off-shore to do their business."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re welcome."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your administration has been predicting a rapid and robust recovery, but the latest economic report suggests that’s not happening."\n
Susan Page: "Should Americans be braced for an economic comeback that is going to take not months, but a year or more?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes to answer uninterrupted."\n
Mike Pence: "When President Trump and I took office, America had gone through the slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression."\n
Mike Pence: "It was when Joe Biden was vice president, they tried to tax and spend, and regulate, and bail our way back to a growing economy."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump cut taxes across the board."\n
Mike Pence: "Despite what Senator Harris says, the average American family of four had $2,000 in savings in taxes."\n
Mike Pence: "And with the rise in wages that occurred, most predominantly for blue collar, hardworking Americans, the average household income for a family of four increased by $4,000 following President Trump’s tax cuts."\n
Mike Pence: "But America, you just heard Senator Harris tell you, on day one, Joe Biden’s going to raise your taxes."\n

Susan Page: "Thank you Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "You’re welcome."\n
Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your administration has been predicting a rapid and robust recovery, but the latest economic report suggests that’s not happening."\n
Susan Page: "Should Americans be braced for an economic comeback that is going to take not months, but a year or more?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes to answer uninterrupted."\n
Mike Pence: "When President Trump and I took office, America had gone through the slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression."\n
Mike Pence: "It was when Joe Biden was vice president, they tried to tax and spend, and regulate, and bail our way back to a growing economy."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump cut taxes across the board."\n
Mike Pence: "Despite what Senator Harris says, the average American family of four had $2,000 in savings in taxes."\n
Mike Pence: "And with the rise in wages that occurred, most predominantly for blue collar, hardworking Americans, the average household income for a family of four increased by $4,000 following President Trump’s tax cuts."\n
Mike Pence: "But America, you just heard Senator Harris tell you, on day one, Joe Biden’s going to raise your taxes."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s really remarkable to think-"\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s not what I said."\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, right after a time where we’re going through a pandemic that lost 22 million jobs at the height, we’ve already added back 11.6 million jobs because we had a president who cut taxes, rolled back regulation, unleashed American energy, fought for free and fair trade and secured four trillion dollars from the Congress of the United States to give direct payments to families, save 50 million jobs through the Paycheck Protection Program."\n
Mike Pence: "We literally have spared no expense to help the American people and the American worker through this."\n

Mike Pence: "When President Trump and I took office, America had gone through the slowest economic recovery since the Great Depression."\n
Mike Pence: "It was when Joe Biden was vice president, they tried to tax and spend, and regulate, and bail our way back to a growing economy."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump cut taxes across the board."\n
Mike Pence: "Despite what Senator Harris says, the average American family of four had $2,000 in savings in taxes."\n
Mike Pence: "And with the rise in wages that occurred, most predominantly for blue collar, hardworking Americans, the average household income for a family of four increased by $4,000 following President Trump’s tax cuts."\n

Kamala Harris: "That’s not what I said."\n

Mike Pence: "We literally have spared no expense to help the American people and the American worker through this."\n

Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden will not raise taxes on anyone who makes less than $400,000 a year."\n
Kamala Harris: "He has been very clear about that."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden will not end fracking, he has been very clear about that."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe Biden is the one who, during the great recession was responsible for the Recovery Act that brought America back."\n
Kamala Harris: "And now that Trump-"\n
Kamala Harris: "… for the Recovery Act that brought America back, and now the Trump-Pence administration wants to take credit when they rode the coattails of Joe Biden’s success for the economy that they had at the beginning of their term."\n
Kamala Harris: "Of course, now the economy is a complete disaster, but Joe Biden on the one hand did that."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the other hand, you have Donald Trump who has reigned over a recession that is being compared to the Great Depression."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the one hand, you have Joe Biden who was responsible with President Barack Obama for the Affordable Care Act, which brought healthcare to over 20 million Americans and protected people with preexisting conditions."\n
Kamala Harris: "And what it also did is it saved those families who otherwise were going bankrupt because of hospital bills they could not afford."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the other hand, you have Donald Trump, who is in court right now, trying to get rid of-"\n
Mike Pence: "Susan, please [crosstalk 00:30:54]"\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris."\n

Susan Page: "Once again, you’ve provided the perfect segue to a new topic, which is climate change."\n
Susan Page: "And Vice President Pence, I’d like to pose the first question to you."\n
Susan Page: "This year, we’ve seen record-setting hurricanes in the South."\n
Susan Page: "Another one, Hurricane Delta, is now threatening the Gulf, and we have seen record-setting wildfires in the West."\n
Susan Page: "Do you believe as the scientific community has concluded, that man-made climate change has made wildfires bigger, hotter, and more deadly and have made hurricanes wetter, slower and more damaging?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n

Susan Page: "This year, we’ve seen record-setting hurricanes in the South."\n
Susan Page: "Another one, Hurricane Delta, is now threatening the Gulf, and we have seen record-setting wildfires in the West."\n
Susan Page: "Do you believe as the scientific community has concluded, that man-made climate change has made wildfires bigger, hotter, and more deadly and have made hurricanes wetter, slower and more damaging?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, first, I’m very proud of our record on the environment, on conservation."\n
Mike Pence: "According to all of the best estimates, our air and land are cleaner than any time ever recorded."\n
Mike Pence: "Our water is among the cleanest in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "And just a little while ago, the president signed the Outdoors Act."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s the largest investment in our public lands and public parks in 100 years."\n
Mike Pence: "So President Trump has made a commitment to conservation and to the environment."\n
Mike Pence: "Now with regard to climate change, the climate is changing, but the issue is what’s the cause and what do we do about it?"\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump has made it clear that we’re going to continue to listen to the science."\n
Mike Pence: "Now Joe Biden and Kamala Harris would put us back in the Paris Climate Accord."\n
Mike Pence: "They’d impose the Green New Deal, which would crush American energy, would increase the energy costs of American families in their homes, and literally would crush American jobs."\n

Susan Page: "You have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, first, I’m very proud of our record on the environment, on conservation."\n
Mike Pence: "According to all of the best estimates, our air and land are cleaner than any time ever recorded."\n
Mike Pence: "Our water is among the cleanest in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "And just a little while ago, the president signed the Outdoors Act."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s the largest investment in our public lands and public parks in 100 years."\n
Mike Pence: "So President Trump has made a commitment to conservation and to the environment."\n
Mike Pence: "Now with regard to climate change, the climate is changing, but the issue is what’s the cause and what do we do about it?"\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump has made it clear that we’re going to continue to listen to the science."\n
Mike Pence: "Now Joe Biden and Kamala Harris would put us back in the Paris Climate Accord."\n
Mike Pence: "They’d impose the Green New Deal, which would crush American energy, would increase the energy costs of American families in their homes, and literally would crush American jobs."\n
Mike Pence: "And President Trump and I believe that the progress that we have made in a cleaner environment has been happening precisely because we have a strong, free market economy."\n
Mike Pence: "What’s remarkable is the United States has reduced CO2 more than the countries that are still in the Paris Climate Accord, but we’ve done it through innovation."\n
Mike Pence: "And we’ve done it through natural gas and fracking, which Senator, the American people can go look at the record."\n

Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, first, I’m very proud of our record on the environment, on conservation."\n
Mike Pence: "According to all of the best estimates, our air and land are cleaner than any time ever recorded."\n
Mike Pence: "Our water is among the cleanest in the world."\n
Mike Pence: "And just a little while ago, the president signed the Outdoors Act."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s the largest investment in our public lands and public parks in 100 years."\n
Mike Pence: "So President Trump has made a commitment to conservation and to the environment."\n
Mike Pence: "Now with regard to climate change, the climate is changing, but the issue is what’s the cause and what do we do about it?"\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump has made it clear that we’re going to continue to listen to the science."\n
Mike Pence: "Now Joe Biden and Kamala Harris would put us back in the Paris Climate Accord."\n
Mike Pence: "They’d impose the Green New Deal, which would crush American energy, would increase the energy costs of American families in their homes, and literally would crush American jobs."\n
Mike Pence: "And President Trump and I believe that the progress that we have made in a cleaner environment has been happening precisely because we have a strong, free market economy."\n
Mike Pence: "What’s remarkable is the United States has reduced CO2 more than the countries that are still in the Paris Climate Accord, but we’ve done it through innovation."\n
Mike Pence: "And we’ve done it through natural gas and fracking, which Senator, the American people can go look at the record."\n
Mike Pence: "I know Joe Biden says otherwise now, as you do, but the both of you repeatedly committed to abolishing fossil fuel and banning of fracking."\n
 n150387b07p8990 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 80000 4 Pence attacks the climate change policy of Biden and Harris attack 60000 3 not_argumentative neither
Mike Pence: "So President Trump has made a commitment to conservation and to the environment."\n
Mike Pence: "Now with regard to climate change, the climate is changing, but the issue is what’s the cause and what do we do about it?"\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump has made it clear that we’re going to continue to listen to the science."\n
Mike Pence: "Now Joe Biden and Kamala Harris would put us back in the Paris Climate Accord."\n
Mike Pence: "They’d impose the Green New Deal, which would crush American energy, would increase the energy costs of American families in their homes, and literally would crush American jobs."\n
Mike Pence: "And President Trump and I believe that the progress that we have made in a cleaner environment has been happening precisely because we have a strong, free market economy."\n
Mike Pence: "What’s remarkable is the United States has reduced CO2 more than the countries that are still in the Paris Climate Accord, but we’ve done it through innovation."\n
Mike Pence: "And we’ve done it through natural gas and fracking, which Senator, the American people can go look at the record."\n
Mike Pence: "I know Joe Biden says otherwise now, as you do, but the both of you repeatedly committed to abolishing fossil fuel and banning of fracking."\n
Mike Pence: "And so by creating the kind of American innovation, we’re actually steering toward a stronger and better environment."\n
Mike Pence: "With regard to wildfires, President Trump and I believe that forest management has to be front and center."\n
Mike Pence: "And even Governor Gavin Newsom from your state has agreed, we’ve got to work on forest management."\n
Mike Pence: "And with regard to hurricanes, the National Oceanic Administration tells us that actually as difficult as they are, there are no more hurricanes today than there were 100 years ago-"\n
Susan Page: "Thank you [crosstalk 00:35:24]"\n
Mike Pence: "… but many of the climate alarmists-"\n

Susan Page: "You have two minutes."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, before I leave that, let me speak to voting records if I can."\n
Mike Pence: "Everybody knows that NAFTA costs literally thousands of American factories to close."\n
Mike Pence: "We saw automotive jobs go South of the border."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump fought to renegotiate NAFTA."\n
Mike Pence: "In the United States, Mexico and Canada the agreement is now the law of the land."\n
Mike Pence: "American people deserve to know Senator Kamala Harris was one of only 10 members of the Senate to vote against the USMCA."\n
Mike Pence: "It was a huge win for American auto workers."\n
Mike Pence: "It was a huge win for American farmers, especially dairy in the upper Midwest."\n
Mike Pence: "But Senator you said it didn’t go far enough on climate change, you put your radical environmental agenda ahead of American auto workers and a head of American jobs."\n

Mike Pence: "In the United States, Mexico and Canada the agreement is now the law of the land."\n
Mike Pence: "American people deserve to know Senator Kamala Harris was one of only 10 members of the Senate to vote against the USMCA."\n
Mike Pence: "It was a huge win for American auto workers."\n
Mike Pence: "It was a huge win for American farmers, especially dairy in the upper Midwest."\n
Mike Pence: "But Senator you said it didn’t go far enough on climate change, you put your radical environmental agenda ahead of American auto workers and a head of American jobs."\n
Mike Pence: "I think the American people deserve to know that it’s probably why Newsweek magazine said that Kamala Harris was the most liberal member of the United States Senate in 2019, more liberal than Bernie Sanders, more liberal than any of the others in the United States Senate."\n
Mike Pence: "So now with regard to China, Susan first and foremost, China is to blame for the coronavirus and President Trump is not happy about it."\n
Mike Pence: "He’s made that very clear, made it clear again today that China and the world health organization did not play straight with the American people."\n
Mike Pence: "They did not let our personnel into China to get information on the Coronavirus until the middle of February."\n
Mike Pence: "Fortunately, President Trump in dealing with China from the outset of this administration, standing up to China that had been taking advantage of America for decades in the wake of Joe Biden’s cheerleading for China."\n

Mike Pence: "So now with regard to China, Susan first and foremost, China is to blame for the coronavirus and President Trump is not happy about it."\n
Mike Pence: "He’s made that very clear, made it clear again today that China and the world health organization did not play straight with the American people."\n
Mike Pence: "They did not let our personnel into China to get information on the Coronavirus until the middle of February."\n
Mike Pence: "Fortunately, President Trump in dealing with China from the outset of this administration, standing up to China that had been taking advantage of America for decades in the wake of Joe Biden’s cheerleading for China."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump made that decision before the end of January to suspend all travel from China."\n
Mike Pence: "And again, the American people deserve to know Joe Biden opposed President Trump’s decision to suspend all travel from China."\n
Mike Pence: "He said it was hysterical."\n

Susan Page: "Senator Harris, let me ask you the same question that I asked the vice-president."\n
Susan Page: "How would you describe our fundamental relationship with China?"\n
Susan Page: "Are we competitors?"\n
Susan Page: "Adversaries?"\n
Susan Page: "Enemies?"\n
Susan Page: "You’ll have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Susan, the Trump administration’s perspective and approach to China has resulted in the loss of American lives, American jobs, and America’s standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "There is a weird obsession that President Trump has had with getting rid of whatever accomplishment was achieved by President Obama and Vice President Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "For example, they created within the White House and office that basically was responsible for monitoring pandemics."\n
Kamala Harris: "They got rid of it."\n
Mike Pence: "Not true."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a team of disease experts that President Obama and Vice President Biden dispatched to China to monitor what is now predictable and what might happen."\n
Kamala Harris: "They pulled them out."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now are looking at 210,000 Americans who have lost their lives."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n

Susan Page: "Senator Harris, let me ask you the same question that I asked the vice-president."\n
Susan Page: "How would you describe our fundamental relationship with China?"\n
Susan Page: "Are we competitors?"\n
Susan Page: "Adversaries?"\n
Susan Page: "Enemies?"\n
Susan Page: "You’ll have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Susan, the Trump administration’s perspective and approach to China has resulted in the loss of American lives, American jobs, and America’s standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "There is a weird obsession that President Trump has had with getting rid of whatever accomplishment was achieved by President Obama and Vice President Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "For example, they created within the White House and office that basically was responsible for monitoring pandemics."\n
Kamala Harris: "They got rid of it."\n
Mike Pence: "Not true."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a team of disease experts that President Obama and Vice President Biden dispatched to China to monitor what is now predictable and what might happen."\n
Kamala Harris: "They pulled them out."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now are looking at 210,000 Americans who have lost their lives."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n

Susan Page: "Are we competitors?"\n
Susan Page: "Adversaries?"\n
Susan Page: "Enemies?"\n
Susan Page: "You’ll have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Susan, the Trump administration’s perspective and approach to China has resulted in the loss of American lives, American jobs, and America’s standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "There is a weird obsession that President Trump has had with getting rid of whatever accomplishment was achieved by President Obama and Vice President Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "For example, they created within the White House and office that basically was responsible for monitoring pandemics."\n
Kamala Harris: "They got rid of it."\n
Mike Pence: "Not true."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a team of disease experts that President Obama and Vice President Biden dispatched to China to monitor what is now predictable and what might happen."\n
Kamala Harris: "They pulled them out."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now are looking at 210,000 Americans who have lost their lives."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n
Kamala Harris: "We mentioned before, the trade deal, the trade war, they wanted to call it with China."\n
Kamala Harris: "It resulted in the loss of over 300 manufacturing jobs and a manufacturing recession and the American consumer paid thousands of dollars, more for goods because of that failed war that they called it."\n
 n160047b07p4851 80000 3 not_related neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Kamala Harris: "There is a weird obsession that President Trump has had with getting rid of whatever accomplishment was achieved by President Obama and Vice President Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "For example, they created within the White House and office that basically was responsible for monitoring pandemics."\n
Kamala Harris: "They got rid of it."\n
Mike Pence: "Not true."\n
Kamala Harris: "There was a team of disease experts that President Obama and Vice President Biden dispatched to China to monitor what is now predictable and what might happen."\n
Kamala Harris: "They pulled them out."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now are looking at 210,000 Americans who have lost their lives."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n
Kamala Harris: "We mentioned before, the trade deal, the trade war, they wanted to call it with China."\n
Kamala Harris: "It resulted in the loss of over 300 manufacturing jobs and a manufacturing recession and the American consumer paid thousands of dollars, more for goods because of that failed war that they called it."\n
Kamala Harris: "Then let’s talk about standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "Pew, a reputable research firm has done an analysis that shows that leaders of all of our formerly allied countries have now decided that they hold in greater esteem and respect Xi Jinping the head of the Chinese communist party than they do Donald Trump."\n
Kamala Harris: "The President of the United States, the commander in chief of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "This is where we are today because of a failure of leadership by this administration."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, we’ve seen changes in the role of the United States in terms of global leadership over the past four years."\n

Kamala Harris: "There was a team of disease experts that President Obama and Vice President Biden dispatched to China to monitor what is now predictable and what might happen."\n
Kamala Harris: "They pulled them out."\n
Kamala Harris: "We now are looking at 210,000 Americans who have lost their lives."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n
Kamala Harris: "We mentioned before, the trade deal, the trade war, they wanted to call it with China."\n
Kamala Harris: "It resulted in the loss of over 300 manufacturing jobs and a manufacturing recession and the American consumer paid thousands of dollars, more for goods because of that failed war that they called it."\n
Kamala Harris: "Then let’s talk about standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "Pew, a reputable research firm has done an analysis that shows that leaders of all of our formerly allied countries have now decided that they hold in greater esteem and respect Xi Jinping the head of the Chinese communist party than they do Donald Trump."\n
Kamala Harris: "The President of the United States, the commander in chief of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "This is where we are today because of a failure of leadership by this administration."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, we’ve seen changes in the role of the United States in terms of global leadership over the past four years."\n
Susan Page: "And of course times do change."\n
Susan Page: "What’s your definition?"\n
Susan Page: "We’ve seen strains with China, of course, as the vice president mentioned, we’ve seen strange with our traditional allies in NATO and elsewhere."\n
Susan Page: "What is your definition of the role of American leadership in 2020?"\n

Kamala Harris: "Let’s look at the job situation."\n
Kamala Harris: "We mentioned before, the trade deal, the trade war, they wanted to call it with China."\n
Kamala Harris: "It resulted in the loss of over 300 manufacturing jobs and a manufacturing recession and the American consumer paid thousands of dollars, more for goods because of that failed war that they called it."\n
Kamala Harris: "Then let’s talk about standing."\n
Kamala Harris: "Pew, a reputable research firm has done an analysis that shows that leaders of all of our formerly allied countries have now decided that they hold in greater esteem and respect Xi Jinping the head of the Chinese communist party than they do Donald Trump."\n
Kamala Harris: "The President of the United States, the commander in chief of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "This is where we are today because of a failure of leadership by this administration."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, we’ve seen changes in the role of the United States in terms of global leadership over the past four years."\n
Susan Page: "And of course times do change."\n
Susan Page: "What’s your definition?"\n
Susan Page: "We’ve seen strains with China, of course, as the vice president mentioned, we’ve seen strange with our traditional allies in NATO and elsewhere."\n
Susan Page: "What is your definition of the role of American leadership in 2020?"\n
Kamala Harris: "So I love talking with Joe about a lot of these issues and Joe, I think he said it quite well."\n
Kamala Harris: "He says, “Foreign policy, it might sound complicated, but really it’s relationships.” Just think about it as relationships."\n
 n160058b07p5657 40000 5 The first sentence shows an attack. attack 20000 5 not_related neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither
Kamala Harris: "People who’ve stood with, you got to stand with them."\n
Kamala Harris: "You got to know who your adversaries are and keep them in check."\n
Kamala Harris: "But what we have seen with Donald Trump is that he has betrayed our friends and embraced dictators around the world."\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s take for example, Russia."\n
Kamala Harris: "So I serve on the intelligence committee of the United States Senate."\n
Kamala Harris: "America’s Intelligence Community told us Russia interfered in the election of the president of the United States in 2016 and his plan in 2020."\n
Kamala Harris: "Christopher Wray, the director of the FBI said the same, but Donald Trump, the commander in chief of the United States of America prefers to take the word of Vladimir Putin over the word of the American Intelligence Community."\n
Kamala Harris: "You look at our friends at NATO, he has walked away from agreements."\n
Kamala Harris: "You can look at the Iran nuclear deal, which now has put us in a position where we are less safe because they are building up what might end up being a significant nuclear arsenal."\n
Kamala Harris: "We were in that deal guys."\n
Kamala Harris: "We were in the Iran nuclear deal with friends, with allies around the country."\n
Kamala Harris: "And because of Donald Trump’s unilateral approach to foreign policy, coupled with his isolationism, he pulled us out and has made America less safe."\n
Kamala Harris: "So Susan it’s about relationships."\n
Kamala Harris: "And the thing that has always been part of the strength of our nation in addition to our great military has been that we keep our word, but Donald Trump doesn’t understand that because he doesn’t understand what it means to be honest."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n

Mike Pence: "And we particularly hope that we don’t see the kind of attacks on her Christian faith that we saw before."\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, the Democrat chairman of the Judiciary Committee before, when Judge Barrett was being confirmed for the court of appeals, expressed concern that the dogma of her faith lived loudly and her, and Dick Durbin of Illinois said that it was a concern."\n
Mike Pence: "Senator, I know one of our judicial nominees you actually attacked, because they were a member of the Catholic Knights of Columbus."\n

Mike Pence: "And we particularly hope that we don’t see the kind of attacks on her Christian faith that we saw before."\n

Mike Pence: "Just because the Knights of Columbus holds pro-life views-"\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President."\n
Susan Page: "Your time is up."\n
Mike Pence: "… And [crosstalk 00:23:06]."\n
Mike Pence: "So, my hope is that when the hearing takes place that-"\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President Pence."\n
Mike Pence: "… That Judge Amy Coney Barrett will be respectfully voted and confirmed into the Supreme court of the United States."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President Pence."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, you’re the Senator from and former Attorney General of California."\n
Susan Page: "So, let me ask you a parallel question to the one I posed to the Vice President."\n
Susan Page: "If Roe V Wade is overturned, what would you want California to do?"\n
Susan Page: "Would you want your home state to enact no restrictions on access to abortion?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n

Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, Joe Biden and I are both people of faith, and it’s insulting to suggest that we would knock anyone for their faith, and in fact, Joe, if elected, will be only the second practicing Catholic as President of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the issue of this nomination, Joe and I are very clear, as are the majority of the American people, we are 27 days before the decision about who will be the next President of the United States, and before, when this conversation has come up, it’s been about election year or election time."\n

Susan Page: "If Roe V Wade is overturned, what would you want California to do?"\n
Susan Page: "Would you want your home state to enact no restrictions on access to abortion?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, Joe Biden and I are both people of faith, and it’s insulting to suggest that we would knock anyone for their faith, and in fact, Joe, if elected, will be only the second practicing Catholic as President of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the issue of this nomination, Joe and I are very clear, as are the majority of the American people, we are 27 days before the decision about who will be the next President of the United States, and before, when this conversation has come up, it’s been about election year or election time."\n
Kamala Harris: "We’re literally in an election."\n
 n160186b07p8490 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 90000 5 not_argumentative neither
Susan Page: "Thank you, Vice President Pence."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, you’re the Senator from and former Attorney General of California."\n
Susan Page: "So, let me ask you a parallel question to the one I posed to the Vice President."\n
Susan Page: "If Roe V Wade is overturned, what would you want California to do?"\n
Susan Page: "Would you want your home state to enact no restrictions on access to abortion?"\n
Susan Page: "And you have two minutes uninterrupted."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, Joe Biden and I are both people of faith, and it’s insulting to suggest that we would knock anyone for their faith, and in fact, Joe, if elected, will be only the second practicing Catholic as President of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the issue of this nomination, Joe and I are very clear, as are the majority of the American people, we are 27 days before the decision about who will be the next President of the United States, and before, when this conversation has come up, it’s been about election year or election time."\n
Kamala Harris: "We’re literally in an election."\n
Kamala Harris: "Over 4 million people have voted."\n
Kamala Harris: "People are in the process of voting right now."\n
Kamala Harris: "And so, Joe has been very clear, as the American people are, let the American people fill that seat in the White House."\n
Kamala Harris: "And then we’ll fill that seat on the United States Supreme court, and to your point, Susan, the issues before us, couldn’t be more serious."\n
 n160190b07p9197 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 90000 5 not_related neither 40000 5 not_related neither
Kamala Harris: "Thank you, Susan."\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, Joe Biden and I are both people of faith, and it’s insulting to suggest that we would knock anyone for their faith, and in fact, Joe, if elected, will be only the second practicing Catholic as President of the United States."\n
Kamala Harris: "On the issue of this nomination, Joe and I are very clear, as are the majority of the American people, we are 27 days before the decision about who will be the next President of the United States, and before, when this conversation has come up, it’s been about election year or election time."\n
Kamala Harris: "We’re literally in an election."\n
Kamala Harris: "Over 4 million people have voted."\n
Kamala Harris: "People are in the process of voting right now."\n
Kamala Harris: "And so, Joe has been very clear, as the American people are, let the American people fill that seat in the White House."\n
Kamala Harris: "And then we’ll fill that seat on the United States Supreme court, and to your point, Susan, the issues before us, couldn’t be more serious."\n
Kamala Harris: "There’s the issue of choice and I will always fight for a woman’s right to make a decision about her own body."\n
Kamala Harris: "It should be her decision and not that Donald Trump, and the Vice President, Michael Pence, but let’s also look at what else is before the court."\n
Kamala Harris: "It’s the Affordable Care Act like literally in the midst of a public health pandemic when over 210,000 people have died and 7 million people probably have what will be in the future considered a preexisting condition because you contracted the virus."\n
Kamala Harris: "Donald Trump is in court right now trying to get rid of the Affordable Care Act, and I said it before, and it bears repeating."\n
Kamala Harris: "This means that there will be no more protections if they win for people with pre-existing conditions."\n
Kamala Harris: "This means that over 20 million people will lose your coverage."\n
Kamala Harris: "It means that if you’re under the age of 26, you can’t stay on your parents’ coverage anymore, and here’s the thing."\n

Kamala Harris: "It should be her decision and not that Donald Trump, and the Vice President, Michael Pence, but let’s also look at what else is before the court."\n

Kamala Harris: "This means that over 20 million people will lose your coverage."\n
Kamala Harris: "It means that if you’re under the age of 26, you can’t stay on your parents’ coverage anymore, and here’s the thing."\n
Kamala Harris: "The contrast couldn’t be more clear."\n

Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s true leadership."\n
Susan Page: "You’ve mentioned earlier, Vice President Pence, that the president was committed to maintaining protections for people with pre-existing conditions, but you do have this court case that you are supporting, your administration supporting that would strike down the Affordable Care Act."\n
Susan Page: "The president says, President Trump says that he’s going to protect people with preexisting conditions, but he has not explained how he would do that, and that was one of the toughest nuts to crack when they were passing the Affordable Care Act."\n
Susan Page: "So, tell us specifically, how would your administration protect Americans with preexisting conditions to have access to affordable insurance if the Affordable Care Act is struck down?"\n
Mike Pence: "Well, thank you, Susan, but let me just say, addressing your very first question."\n

 n160217b07p2023 50000 5 incomplete neither 60000 3 not_argumentative neither 40000 5 incomplete neither
Susan Page: "Thank you, Senator Harris."\n
Kamala Harris: "That’s true leadership."\n
Susan Page: "You’ve mentioned earlier, Vice President Pence, that the president was committed to maintaining protections for people with pre-existing conditions, but you do have this court case that you are supporting, your administration supporting that would strike down the Affordable Care Act."\n
Susan Page: "The president says, President Trump says that he’s going to protect people with preexisting conditions, but he has not explained how he would do that, and that was one of the toughest nuts to crack when they were passing the Affordable Care Act."\n
Susan Page: "So, tell us specifically, how would your administration protect Americans with preexisting conditions to have access to affordable insurance if the Affordable Care Act is struck down?"\n
Mike Pence: "Well, thank you, Susan, but let me just say, addressing your very first question."\n
Mike Pence: "I couldn’t be more proud to serve as vice president to a president who stands without apology for the sanctity of human life."\n
Mike Pence: "I’m pro-life."\n
Mike Pence: "I don’t apologize for it, and this is another one of those cases where there’s such a dramatic contrast."\n
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden and Kamala Harris support taxpayer funding of abortion all the way up to the moment of birth."\n
Mike Pence: "Late term abortion."\n
Mike Pence: "They want to increase funding to Planned Parenthood of America."\n
Mike Pence: "For our part, I would never presume how Judge Amy Coney Barrett would rule on the Supreme Court of the United States, but we’ll continue to stand strong for the right to life."\n
Mike Pence: "When you speak about the Supreme Court, though, I think the American people really deserve an answer, Senator Harris."\n
Mike Pence: "Are you and Joe Biden going to pack the court if Judge Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed?"\n
 n160220b07p2123 60000 3 These sentences are an providing argument. attack 50000 5 not_related neither 90000 5 incomplete neither
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden and Kamala Harris support taxpayer funding of abortion all the way up to the moment of birth."\n
Mike Pence: "Late term abortion."\n
Mike Pence: "They want to increase funding to Planned Parenthood of America."\n
Mike Pence: "For our part, I would never presume how Judge Amy Coney Barrett would rule on the Supreme Court of the United States, but we’ll continue to stand strong for the right to life."\n
Mike Pence: "When you speak about the Supreme Court, though, I think the American people really deserve an answer, Senator Harris."\n
Mike Pence: "Are you and Joe Biden going to pack the court if Judge Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed?"\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, there’ve been 29 vacancies on the Supreme Court during presidential election years from George Washington to Barack Obama."\n
Mike Pence: "Presidents have nominated in all 29 cases, but your party is actually openly advocating, adding seats to the Supreme court, which has had nine seats for 150 years if you don’t get your way."\n
Mike Pence: "This is a classic case of if you can’t win by the rules, you’re going to change the rules."\n
Mike Pence: "Now you’ve refused to answer the question."\n
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden has refused to answer the question-"\n
Mike Pence: "No, you’ve refused to answer the question."\n
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden has refused to answer the question."\n
Mike Pence: "So I think the American people would really like to know if Judge Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed at the Supreme Court of the United States."\n
Mike Pence: "Are you and Joe Biden, if somehow you win this election, going to pack the Supreme Court to get your way?"\n
 n160229b07p2931 40000 5 not_argumentative neither 50000 5 the second sentence showing attack to the 1st sentence. attack 20000 5 not_related neither
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden and Kamala Harris support taxpayer funding of abortion all the way up to the moment of birth."\n
Mike Pence: "Late term abortion."\n
Mike Pence: "They want to increase funding to Planned Parenthood of America."\n
Mike Pence: "For our part, I would never presume how Judge Amy Coney Barrett would rule on the Supreme Court of the United States, but we’ll continue to stand strong for the right to life."\n
Mike Pence: "When you speak about the Supreme Court, though, I think the American people really deserve an answer, Senator Harris."\n
Mike Pence: "Are you and Joe Biden going to pack the court if Judge Amy Coney Barrett is confirmed?"\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, there’ve been 29 vacancies on the Supreme Court during presidential election years from George Washington to Barack Obama."\n
Mike Pence: "Presidents have nominated in all 29 cases, but your party is actually openly advocating, adding seats to the Supreme court, which has had nine seats for 150 years if you don’t get your way."\n
Mike Pence: "This is a classic case of if you can’t win by the rules, you’re going to change the rules."\n
Mike Pence: "Now you’ve refused to answer the question."\n
Mike Pence: "Joe Biden has refused to answer the question-"\n

Kamala Harris: "So the Trump Pence administration has been, because I sit on the Senate judiciary committee, Susan as you mentioned, and I’ve witnessed the appointments for lifetime appointments to the federal courts, district courts, courts of appeal, people who are purely ideological, people who have been reviewed by legal professional organizations and found who have been not competent are substandard."\n
Kamala Harris: "And do you know that of the 50 people who President Trump appointed to the court of appeals for lifetime appointments, not one is black?"\n
Kamala Harris: "This is what they’ve been doing."\n
Kamala Harris: "You want to talk about packing a court?"\n
Kamala Harris: "Let’s have that discussion."\n
Susan Page: "All right."\n
Kamala Harris: "Thank you."\n

Mike Pence: "From day one, it is improve the lives of African-Americans, record unemployment, record investments in education."\n

Susan Page: "Vice President Pence, your time is up."\n

Kamala Harris: "I’d like to respond."\n

Kamala Harris: "The only one on this stage, who has personally prosecuted everything from child sexual assault to homicide."\n

Susan Page: "And I’d like you to respond first to the question on our final topic, the election itself."\n
Susan Page: "President Trump has several times refused to commit himself to a peaceful transfer of power after the election."\n
Susan Page: "If your ticket wins and president Trump refuses to accept a peaceful transfer of power, what steps would you and vice president Biden then take?"\n
Susan Page: "What would happen next?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes."\n
Kamala Harris: "So I’ll tell you."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe and I are particularly proud of the coalition that we’ve built around our campaign."\n
Kamala Harris: "We probably have one of the broadest coalitions of folks that you’ve ever seen in a presidential race."\n
Kamala Harris: "Of course, we have the support of Democrats, but also independents and Republicans."\n
Kamala Harris: "In fact, seven members of president George W. Bush’s cabinet are supporting our ticket."\n
Kamala Harris: "We have the support of Colin Powell, Cindy McCain, John Kasich."\n
Kamala Harris: "Over 500 generals, retired generals and former national security experts and advisors are supporting our campaign."\n
Kamala Harris: "And I believe they are doing that because they know that Joe Biden has a deep, deep seated commitment to fight for our democracy, and to fight for the integrity of our democracy, and to bring integrity back to the White House."\n
Kamala Harris: "We believe in the American people, we believe in our democracy, and here’s what I’d like to say to everybody."\n

Susan Page: "Vice president Pence, president Trump has several times refused to commit himself to a peaceful transfer of power after the election."\n
Susan Page: "If vice president Biden is declared the winner and president Trump refuses to accept a peaceful transfer of power, what would be your role and responsibility as vice president?"\n
Susan Page: "What would you personally do?"\n
Susan Page: "You have two minutes."\n
Mike Pence: "Well, Susan, first and foremost, I think we’re going to win this election."\n
Mike Pence: "Because while Joe Biden and Kamala Harris rattle off a long litany of the establishment in Washington, DC and establishment that Joe Biden’s been a part of for 47 years, president Donald Trump has as launched a movement of everyday Americans from every walk of life."\n
Mike Pence: "And I have every confidence that the same Americans that delivered that historic victory in 2016, they see this president’s record where we rebuild our military."\n
Mike Pence: "We revived our economy through tax cuts and rolling back regulation, fighting for fair trade, unleashing American energy."\n
Mike Pence: "We appointed conservatives to our federal courts at every level."\n
Mike Pence: "And we stood with the men and women of law enforcement every single day."\n
Mike Pence: "And I think that movement of Americans has only grown stronger in the last four years."\n
Mike Pence: "But when you talk about accepting the outcome of the election, I must tell you."\n
Mike Pence: "Senator, your party has spent the last three and a half years trying to overturn the results of the last election."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s amazing."\n
Mike Pence: "When Joe Biden was vice president of the United States, the FBI actually spied on president Trump and my campaign."\n
 n160436b07p3641 80000 3 Pence attacks the priorities of Harris's party attack 50000 5 not_argumentative neither 40000 5 not_argumentative neither
Mike Pence: "But when you talk about accepting the outcome of the election, I must tell you."\n
Mike Pence: "Senator, your party has spent the last three and a half years trying to overturn the results of the last election."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s amazing."\n
Mike Pence: "When Joe Biden was vice president of the United States, the FBI actually spied on president Trump and my campaign."\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, there were documents released this week that the CIA actually made a referral to the FBI, documenting that those allegations were coming from the Hillary Clinton campaign."\n
Mike Pence: "And of course, we’ve all seen the avalanche, what you put the country through for the better part of three years, until it was found that there was no obstruction, no collusion, case closed."\n
Mike Pence: "And then Senator Harris, you and your colleagues in the Congress tried to impeach the president of the United States over a phone call."\n
Mike Pence: "And now Hillary Clinton has actually said to Joe Biden that, in her words, under no circumstances, should he concede the election."\n
Mike Pence: "So let me just say, I think we’re going to win this election."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump and I are fighting every day in courthouses to prevent Joe Biden and Kamala Harris from changing the rules and creating this universal mail in voting that’ll create a massive opportunity for voter fraud."\n
Mike Pence: "And we have a free and fair election."\n
Mike Pence: "We know we’re going to have confidence in it."\n
Mike Pence: "And I believe in all my heart that president Donald Trump is going to be reelected for four more years."\n
Susan Page: "I’ve written all the questions that I’ve asked tonight, but for the final question of the debate, I’d like to read a question that someone else wrote."\n
Susan Page: "The Utah Debate Commission asked students in the state to write essays about what they would like to ask you."\n
 n160447b07p4546 40000 5 Both sentences show an attack. attack 50000 5 not_related neither 70000 5 provide support on the statements support
Mike Pence: "Senator, your party has spent the last three and a half years trying to overturn the results of the last election."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s amazing."\n
Mike Pence: "When Joe Biden was vice president of the United States, the FBI actually spied on president Trump and my campaign."\n
Mike Pence: "I mean, there were documents released this week that the CIA actually made a referral to the FBI, documenting that those allegations were coming from the Hillary Clinton campaign."\n
Mike Pence: "And of course, we’ve all seen the avalanche, what you put the country through for the better part of three years, until it was found that there was no obstruction, no collusion, case closed."\n
Mike Pence: "And then Senator Harris, you and your colleagues in the Congress tried to impeach the president of the United States over a phone call."\n
Mike Pence: "And now Hillary Clinton has actually said to Joe Biden that, in her words, under no circumstances, should he concede the election."\n
Mike Pence: "So let me just say, I think we’re going to win this election."\n
Mike Pence: "President Trump and I are fighting every day in courthouses to prevent Joe Biden and Kamala Harris from changing the rules and creating this universal mail in voting that’ll create a massive opportunity for voter fraud."\n
Mike Pence: "And we have a free and fair election."\n
Mike Pence: "We know we’re going to have confidence in it."\n
Mike Pence: "And I believe in all my heart that president Donald Trump is going to be reelected for four more years."\n
Susan Page: "I’ve written all the questions that I’ve asked tonight, but for the final question of the debate, I’d like to read a question that someone else wrote."\n
Susan Page: "The Utah Debate Commission asked students in the state to write essays about what they would like to ask you."\n
Susan Page: "And I want to close tonight’s debate with the question posed by Brecklin Brown."\n

Susan Page: "She’s an eighth grader at Springville Junior High in Springville, Utah."\n
Susan Page: "And here’s what she wrote."\n
Susan Page: "“When I watch the news, all I see is arguing between Democrats and Republicans."\n
Susan Page: "When I watch the news, all I see is citizen fighting against citizen."\n
Susan Page: "When I watch the news, all I see are two candidates from opposing parties trying to tear each other down."\n
Susan Page: "If our leaders can’t get along, how are the citizens supposed to get along?” And then she added, “Your examples could make all the difference to bring us together.” So to each of you in turn, I’d like you to take one minute and respond to Brecklin."\n
Susan Page: "Vice president Pence, you have one minute."\n
Mike Pence: "Brecklin, it’s a wonderful question."\n
Mike Pence: "And let me just commend you for taking an interest in public life."\n
Mike Pence: "I started following the news when I was very young."\n
Mike Pence: "And in America, we believe in a free and open exchange of debate."\n
Mike Pence: "And we celebrate that."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s how we’ve created literally the freest and most prosperous nation in the history of the world."\n
Mike Pence: "I would tell you that, don’t assume that what you’re seeing on your local news networks is synonymous with the American people."\n
Mike Pence: "I look at the relationship between Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg, the late justice who we just lost from the Supreme Court, and the late justice Antonin Scalia."\n

Susan Page: "When I watch the news, all I see are two candidates from opposing parties trying to tear each other down."\n
Susan Page: "If our leaders can’t get along, how are the citizens supposed to get along?” And then she added, “Your examples could make all the difference to bring us together.” So to each of you in turn, I’d like you to take one minute and respond to Brecklin."\n
Susan Page: "Vice president Pence, you have one minute."\n
Mike Pence: "Brecklin, it’s a wonderful question."\n
Mike Pence: "And let me just commend you for taking an interest in public life."\n
Mike Pence: "I started following the news when I was very young."\n
Mike Pence: "And in America, we believe in a free and open exchange of debate."\n
Mike Pence: "And we celebrate that."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s how we’ve created literally the freest and most prosperous nation in the history of the world."\n
Mike Pence: "I would tell you that, don’t assume that what you’re seeing on your local news networks is synonymous with the American people."\n
Mike Pence: "I look at the relationship between Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg, the late justice who we just lost from the Supreme Court, and the late justice Antonin Scalia."\n
Mike Pence: "They were on polar opposites on the Supreme Court of the United States."\n
Mike Pence: "One very liberal one, very conservative."\n
Mike Pence: "But what’s been learned since her passing was the two of them and their families were the very closest of friends."\n
Mike Pence: "Here in America, we can disagree."\n

Mike Pence: "And in America, we believe in a free and open exchange of debate."\n
Mike Pence: "And we celebrate that."\n
Mike Pence: "It’s how we’ve created literally the freest and most prosperous nation in the history of the world."\n
Mike Pence: "I would tell you that, don’t assume that what you’re seeing on your local news networks is synonymous with the American people."\n
Mike Pence: "I look at the relationship between Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg, the late justice who we just lost from the Supreme Court, and the late justice Antonin Scalia."\n
Mike Pence: "They were on polar opposites on the Supreme Court of the United States."\n
Mike Pence: "One very liberal one, very conservative."\n
Mike Pence: "But what’s been learned since her passing was the two of them and their families were the very closest of friends."\n
Mike Pence: "Here in America, we can disagree."\n
Mike Pence: "We can debate vigorously as Senator Harris and I have on this stage tonight."\n
Mike Pence: "But when the debate is over, we come together as Americans."\n
Mike Pence: "And that’s what people do, in big cities and small towns all across this country."\n
Mike Pence: "So I just want to encourage you, Brecklin."\n
Mike Pence: "I want to tell you that we’re going to work every day to have government as good as our people, and the American people each and every day."\n
Mike Pence: "Love a good debate."\n

Mike Pence: "And that’s what people do, in big cities and small towns all across this country."\n

Mike Pence: "Love a good debate."\n
Mike Pence: "We love a good argument."\n
Mike Pence: "But we always come together and are always there for one another in times of need."\n
Mike Pence: "And we’ve especially learned that through the difficulties of this year."\n

Susan Page: "Senator Harris, what would you say to Brecklin?"\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, I love hearing from our young leaders."\n
Kamala Harris: "And when I hear her words, when I hear your words, Brecklin, I know our future is bright because it is that perspective on who we are and who we should be that is a sign of leadership, and is something we should all aspire to be."\n
Kamala Harris: "And brings me to Joe, Joe Biden."\n

Mike Pence: "I want to tell you that we’re going to work every day to have government as good as our people, and the American people each and every day."\n
Mike Pence: "Love a good debate."\n
Mike Pence: "We love a good argument."\n
Mike Pence: "But we always come together and are always there for one another in times of need."\n
Mike Pence: "And we’ve especially learned that through the difficulties of this year."\n
Susan Page: "Thank you, vice president."\n
Susan Page: "Senator Harris, what would you say to Brecklin?"\n
Kamala Harris: "First of all, I love hearing from our young leaders."\n
Kamala Harris: "And when I hear her words, when I hear your words, Brecklin, I know our future is bright because it is that perspective on who we are and who we should be that is a sign of leadership, and is something we should all aspire to be."\n
Kamala Harris: "And brings me to Joe, Joe Biden."\n
Kamala Harris: "One of the reasons that Joe decided to run for president is after Charlottesville, which we talked about earlier."\n
Kamala Harris: "It so troubled him and upset him like it did all of us, that there was that kind of hate and division."\n
Kamala Harris: "What propelled Joe to run for president was to see that over the course of the last four years, what Brecklin described has been happening."\n
Kamala Harris: "Joe has a longstanding reputation of working across the aisle, and working in a bipartisan way."\n
Kamala Harris: "And that’s what he’s going to do as president."\n
